10025.description: Make a difference by becoming a Sprout Day Trip Leader! Are you passionate about working with people who have developmental disabilities? Are you looking for a fun, flexible opportunity where you can actually see the difference that you're making? If so, Sprout may be exactly what you're looking for! Sprout's NYC Program provides evening and weekend recreational activities for highly-social adults with mild-to-moderate developmental disabilities. These activities are all over the five boroughs of New York City and include sporting events, museums, art classes, festivals, dinners and more! Sprout Leaders provide supervision to our groups for 2-6 hour long excursions while encouraging positive socialization and having fun with them. Leaders also assist with some logistical elements of activities such as handling a small budget or directing a participant to the nearest subway station. Each month, Leaders are sent a calendar of events and can choose the activities they would like to lead. We only ask that Leaders follow through with the commitment they make to assist with those activities. NO special background or education is required to become a Sprout leader. We encourage people from all cultures and professions, and of all ethnic and educational backgrounds. Once accepted into the program, you will receive a training session which will provide the necessary tools to sign up for and lead future activities. *We encourage applicants with diverse experience-levels and backgrounds *Must be 21 years or older *Fluency in English required TO APPLY: h ttp: gosprout.org/vacation-programs/volunteer/ OR EMAIL: l eadership@gosprout.org

Come join our growing organization! This is an unpaid internship opportunity. However, intern can earn educational credits based upon the learning institution's guidelines. It is a tremendous resume-building opportunity to gain first hand real-world work experience at a 4 star rated charity. Job Title Grant Writing Internship - Government Applications Coordinator Job Responsibilities -Assist clients in applying for government aid programs, such as SNAP (food stamps), Medicaid, Housing, Social Security, and other programs. -Identify and research public and private grant opportunities pertinent to our organization's mission. -Collect and maintain various verification paperwork from clients for government aid applications. -Schedule and conduct client meetings. -Communicate and follow up with clients regarding government aid applications and status updates. -Assist Government Entitlements Director with administrative tasks. -Communicate with government aid agencies as needed. Job Requirements -Relevant coursework completed or experience in the Grant Writing and/or Government entitlements field. -Must be detail oriented and organized with paperwork. -Good interpersonal skills. -Must have a strong desire to help underprivileged people. If you are interested, please email your resume and cover letter and include in your application what makes you the ideal candidate for the position. Email is sbhinterns@gmail.com

11222.description: Northside Charter High School is looking for a Volunteer Board of Trustees Member. This position is reporting to the Chairperson, Board of Trustees (\"Board\"). General Responsibilities: Each trustee is responsible for actively participating in the work of the Northside Charter High School (\"NCHS\" or the \"School\") Board of Trustees (\"Board\") and the life of the school. Each trustee is expected to affirm and strive to fulfill the performance expectations outlined below. These expectations are to be clearly articulated prior to nominating any candidate as a board member. The NCHS Board will nominate the candidate only after s/he has agreed to fulfill these expectations. In addition to the responsibilities below, individual trustees are expected to help each other fulfill the tasks outlined in the collective Job Description of the Board of Trustees. Qualifications: Endorsement and support for the charter and mission of NCHS. An understanding of NCHS as a nonprofit, public charter high school. An understanding that every member of the Board of Trustees serves the entire school and that their service on the Board does not constitute representation on any one constituency of the School. Ability to provide resources and expertise or experience in support of the School. Demonstrate the highest ethical standards and integrity in personal and public conduct. Specific Responsibilities: General Support the School’s mission, purposes, goals, policies, programs, services, strengths and needs. Perform duties of Board membership responsibly. Suggest possible nominees to the Board who are clearly people of achievement and distinction and who can contribute significantly to the work of the Board and the School’s progress. Avoid prejudiced judgments on the basis of information received from individuals and urge those with grievances to follow established policies and procedures. Follow trends in the School’s field of interest Bring goodwill, candor and thoughtfulness to the Board’s deliberations Meetings Prepare for and participate in Board and Committee meetings, including appropriate organizational activities. Ask timely and substantive questions at Board and Committee meetings consistent with your conscience and convictions while supporting the majority decision on issues resolved by the Board Maintain confidentiality of the Board’s executive sessions, and speak for the Board only when authorized to do so. Potential Conflicts Serve the School as a whole rather than any special interest group or constituency, putting the interest of the School first. Avoid even the appearance of a conflict of interest that might embarrass the Board or the School, and disclose any possible conflicts in a timely fashion. Protect the integrity of the Board and School by resigning from the Board in order to accept- or even be considered for- a position with the School, understanding that such action would eliminate the possibility of future service on the Board. Fiduciary Responsibilities Exercise prudence with the Board in the control and oversight of funds and assets. Faithfully read and understand the School’s financial statements and otherwise help the Board fulfill its fiduciary duties. Fundraising Assist the Board and staff by implementing fundraising strategies through cooperation and personal influence with others (corporations, foundations, and individuals). APPLICATION PROCEDURES To apply, please send resume and letter of qualifications and interest to karaffakaley@gmail.com.
11222.title: Volunteer Board of Trustees Member

11222.description: Health, wellness, and movement as a right of life rather than a luxury. Hosh Kids is a program of Hosh Yoga Inc. Hosh is here to provide a fair chance to explore healthier living for children through yoga, dance, meditation, workshops and strong community development in the Greenpoint and Williamsburg areas of Brooklyn, New York and beyond. Regularly scheduled classes are all donation-based; workshops are priced as affordably as possible @ $5/per class. Dance interns will: A. 1-2 interns will co-teach and assist dance and yoga classes in the studio for credit B. 1-2 interns will lead toddler yoga, music, dance classes for children at a stipend rate C. Assist Program Director in outreach and promotion D. Weekly team meetings and feedback sessions E. Professional Development training available Background in Music, Yoga, Dance: Ballroom, Jazz, Hip Hop, Modern, Ballet Hours: Available Monday/ Wednesday/ Friday a must between 2:30-5:30 ALSO A. Marketing & Advertising intern: Assist in the promotion/outreach/exposure of the organization to current, prospective, and the greater North Brooklyn community. B. Graphic/ Web design intern: Assist in the maintenance of current and new websites of the organization. CSS, HTML 5, and other will be key. C. Communications Intern: Assist in event planning, local business liason, fundraising. Fundraising experience preferred. The internship team will have weekly team meetings. Interns will organize a large community event in the summer. Non-profit resources will be available to support interns. Summer internships possible. Hours: 5-10 hours per week. 3-5 days a week. Some remote work possible. Free Yoga Classes. Free Yoga Classes.
11222.title: Hosh Interns & Volunteers Needed

11221.description: ACE Integration Head Start is looking for a person to assist in updating their web page , printed materials, E.g. Brochures - Flyers and Parent Handbooks.
11221.title: Writer -Content Manager Web /Brochure

11221.description: La programa de visitas amigables en Riseboro Community Partnership, es en un nuevo servicio que estamos empezando en el Programa de manejo de caso. Buscamos voluntarios que sean amables, paciente y quieran trabajar con las personas mayores. Estamos pidiendo que los voluntarios puedan visitar a las personas mayores al menos una vez a la semana, durante una hora. Tambien estamos pidiendo que los voluntarios se comprometan a ser parte de este programa por un periodo m?nimo de al menos 6 meses. Todos los voluntarios deben llenar una solicitud la cual yo se la har? llegar a usted. Tambien tenemos que hacer un \" criminal background check\" ya que como usted sabr? hay muchas personas mayores que han sido expuestas a situaciones dif?ciles con personas que tal vez las hayan tratado mal.
11221.title: Buscando voluntarios para pasar tiempo con nuestro ancianos
11221.org: RIDGEWOOD BUSHWICK SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL INC

11221.description: Riseboro Community Partnership is seeking Fun and innovative volunteers who are interested in spending one hour, one day a week with a homebound senior citizen. Our senior citizens are unable to go out into the community and are looking for a companion to laugh with, talk to, watch television with, paint or draw with and enjoy their time with! We ask that our volunteers commit to a minimum of 6 months with our seniors! This is a mutually rewarding friendship, where you're able to learn about the seniors in your neighborhoods, their art styles, interests and the changes that have occurred to the community over the years! We serve a diverse group of elderly and seek people of all backgrounds and ages (18 and up) to join us in helping them feel more connected to their communities. This Friendly Visiting Program is funded by The NYC Department for the Aging.
11221.title: Spend time with Spanish or Polish speaking seniors during the holiday season
11221.org: RIDGEWOOD BUSHWICK SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL INC

11221.description: This opportunity is available every Thursday morning! Help rescue bread, pastries, and other delicious food that would have been thrown out and help feed the hungry. This event lasts just 30 minutes and will end at St. John's Bread & Life, located at 795 Lexington Ave in Bedstuy. Mediumweight: the average amount of food rescued on this event is 15-30 pounds. Sign up directly on our website: https://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
11221.title: Fight Food Waste and Feed the Hungry in Bushwick every Thursday at 10AM!

11221.description: 826NYC hosts after-school tutoring Monday through Thursday from 3:00pm-5:30pm at the South Williamsburg branch of the Brooklyn Public Library. Because it is a homework-help, reading and creative writing program, you will get to flex your writing skills, as well as your math, science, and history muscles. Don't worry if it's been a while since you've thought about the Pythagorean Theorem, though, staff and volunteers are always around to help! Tutoring offers the chance to give back to the community while also getting to know a bunch of awesome students and volunteers. Why not come check it out?
11221.title: Help NYC students as a tutor at the Williamsburg Library

11220.description: Welcome to D&A! We are a charity school based in China and we are looking for enthusiastic people to come and join us immediately as teachers. No experience as a teacher is required, just a positive attitude, a love for working with children and a desire to see more of the world! Through local funding we are excited to be able to provide 4 people from the US or UK paid volunteer positions and the chance to come and work with us for 6-12 months and really make a difference, not just in our local community, but all over the world through the work we do. We Provide: - 4 day working week, with 3 days off each week to travel China (we offer a weekly itinerary of different places to visit) - 4000rmb monthly allowance for travel and food - Free return flight home (or to your next adventure) for those who are able to stay for 12 months - Free Chinese lessons 4 times a week - Free use of school bikes and scooters - Accommodation with kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, wifi, electricity and gas bills all included - Provided meals on weekend days - Full teacher training - Invitations to random fun activities (BBQ's, Kayaking etc...) and visits to local towns and places of interest In return you'll be helping both the local and international English teaching community through a variety of jobs, including (but not limited to) teaching English classes, the creation of fun English speaking games, field trips, cooking classes, elderly home visits, community inclusion activities (free pancake offering on the street, line dancing with local \"aunties\", movie nights, story telling and much more!) and a whole host of other things! If you are interested please see our website www.dandaschool.com for more information or apply here with a copy of you CV, accompanied by a paragraph introducing yourself and explaining why you would like to come. Please add any questions you may have for us the application and we'll be happy to answer. We are looking for people to start before the school year begins (September 1st), as such, the interview process is quick with all initial successful applications given a Skype interview, with decisions made within a few days. Thank you so much for your time, please share on your Facebook or other social media if you think you have a friend who might be interested! Kind Regards, Dec & Any The D and A in D&A
11220.title: Paid Teaching Role for Charity School - Learn to Teach, Travel China and Make a Difference

11220.description: Womankind works with survivors of gender-based violence to rise above trauma and build a path to healing. We bring critical resources and deep cultural competency to help Asian communities find refuge, recovery and renewal from domestic violence, human trafficking, and sexual violence. Womankind's Brooklyn Community Office holds monthly Movies and Communitiesevent open to the community on the last Friday of every month. After a movie screening, a discussion group is held for viewers to share their thoughts and reflect on the film. We are seeking volunteers who can provide Mandarin interpretation during the event. The volunteer would be present throughout the duration of the screening and especially active during the discussion group. Dates: 7/27/18, 8/31/18, 9/28/18. 10/26/18, 11/30/18, 12/21/18 Time: 4-7pm Please email volunteer@iamwk.org with the subject \"Spanish interpreter\" if interested.
11220.title: Mandarin Interpreter

As part of an ongoing series of public diplomacy activities, we welcome volunteers to help with pre-event outreach and on-site event registration, and other activities to build audiences for this event and other events around the United States (through social media, research, writing).
10036.title: EU-US Economy Visit in New York
10036.org: European Union Delegation to the United States

10036.description: Volunteers are so special to the American Diabetes Association and every hour you give makes a major impact. Volunteers are really the backbone of the event and help to make the day exceptional. We would love for you to become part of this dynamic, passionate and fun group of people that volunteer together at this event. Some examples of volunteer opportunities available: Event Set Up Route Signage Registration Volunteer Check-in Medical Support Rest Stop Start/Finish line cheer teams Active Kids’ Area Lunch Tent Clean-up And more! Sign Up Today for the New York City Step Out! Whether you have an hour to give or eight hours, your donation of time is so valuable and needed. Please reach out to Doris DelValle at ddelvalle@diabetes.org or 631-348-0422 ext 3569
10036.title: New York City Step Out Walk September 30, 2018

10036.description: Looking for a way to network with industry insiders, build your resume, and be a part of the future of film? AAHSFF is now seeking volunteers for the 2018 festival. The 2017 All American High School Film Festival was an amazing success, thanks in large part to our 50+ dedicated and enthusiastic volunteers! The festival will take place in NYC from October 5th - 7th. You can sign up to volunteer for one day or the entire event. Please let us know if you have any special skills that we should consider when processing your application. We look forward to making 2018 bigger and better in every way! *You must have graduated high school to volunteer for the festival. 2018 Festival participants are not permitted, meaning that if you have a film as an official selection in this year's festival you can not be a volunteer. *
10036.title: Help needed for Film Festival in NYC!

10036.description: Volunteer teachers are needed for our TASC (formerly \"GED\") classes. These classes meet on Tuesdays and Thursdays (other time slots will become available later in the fall as the program is expanded). We teach all five subjects that comprise the exam, with the majority of classroom time devoted to the two main subjects: Reading comprehension (Tuesdays) and Math (Thursdays). Each TASC class meets from 6-7:30pm to cover the main subjects, with an additional half-hour (7:30-8pm) allotted for instruction in the other subject areas, as well as tutoring individual students. While some of our volunteers work with us more than one day a week, we ask for a minimum time commitment of a single evening session. Prior teaching experience is a plus. For those who have a passion for teaching but lack formal experience, we provide training as well as a mentoring program, which pairs less experienced volunteers with more experienced ones. Note: The location where we teach our TASC classes is at 459 W 46th Street, but a new volunteer's first visit and subsequent orientation will take place at our main building (located nearby at 422 West 57th St). Together One New York is a non-profit organization whose volunteers are passionate about providing vital resources to immigrants, as well adult education programs for all members of the NYC community. In addition to our TASC classes, resources include language classes, a citizenship program, and English conversation classes. With your help, we can expand our outreach and increase the number of people served. Thank you for considering us! For more information, please visit: http://togetheronenewyork.org/
10036.title: Volunteer Teacher for Adult High School Equivalency Program

10036.description: Shatterproof is a national nonprofit organization dedicated to ending the devastation addiction causes families. We're hosting our 2nd year of 5Ks across the country (11 cities!). Help us capture the emotion as thousands gather together to celebrate their recovery, as well as honor their lost loved ones. Help us show that people living with addiction are not alone. Complete details can be viewed here: http://bit.ly/2018-5kphoto-NYC 1 in 3 people is affected by addiction. Drug overdose is now the #1 cause of accidental death in America, and in just one year (2016-2017), the rate of overdose deaths rose 21%. Enough is enough. By donating your time and talent, you help us put more money towards our mission. 100% of the funds raised at the event also go directly to our mission. Thank you for your consideration. We'll also accept serious hobbyists! We know that not everyone is lucky enough to pay the bills with photography, so if you have a serious passion, please apply!
10036.title: Photographers wanted for event capture (NYC)

10036.description: Shatterproof Rise Up Against Addiction 5K Walk/Run is a national movement. Families, friends, coworkers, and neighbors walk or run 5 kilometers to bring the disease of addiction into the light. Whether you've had a substance use disorder or have watched someone you care about struggle with this disease, join us to show that no one should ever suffer alone. Unite with other walkers and runners, supporting those who have lost a loved one to addiction and celebrating those who are living in recovery today. Every dollar you raise brings us one step closer to ending the devastation of addiction in America. Together, we will reduce the secrecy and remove the shame. Together, we will walk into the light and change the conversation about addiction.
10036.title: Rise Up Against Addiction 5K - NYC

10036.description: Since 2001, the Multiple Myeloma Research Foundation’s family-friendly 5K walk/run program has raised both awareness and funds to support urgent multiple myeloma research. Today, the series is held annually in thirteen cities and participation offers hope, camaraderie and knowledge sharing within our myeloma community and beyond. We’ll be at Hudson River Park, Pier 84 on Saturday, October 20th, and need your help in making this year’s event a great day for our patients as well as their friends and family members! Volunteers can assist in a variety of ways, serving as part of the Welcome Team, Course Team, Event Team or Flex Team. Volunteers will also receive a free t-shirt on the day of the race! Groups welcome! To register, please click the link below: https://walkrun.themmrf.org/newyorkcity18/Account/Register Contact volunteers@themmrf.org with questions or for more information.
10036.title: HELP NEEDED MMRF Team for Cure 5K Walk/Run New York City

10036.description: ABOUT THE MENTORSHIP As a High School or College Access Mentor you will guide the success of BTNY High School students by supporting them through a year of high school, helping them to prepare for success in a 4-year college. YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE... Mentor a core group of 12-15 1high school students in a specific grade level. Ensure that your students meet organizational expectations, including: 85% or above in each academic class Participation in at least two extracurricular activities Attendance to all six Super Saturdays (and Seminars if in 9 th or 10 th grades) College Access Mentors only: Apply to at least 12 best fit colleges (including at least 1 SUNY and 1 CUNY school) College Access Mentors only: Submit all financial aid applications College Access Mentors only: Apply to at least 5 scholarships Conduct monthly check-ins by phone or video chat with a core group of 12-15 students, and report the information gathered during those meetings in a timely fashion Work onsite during six Saturdays throughout the academic year with other HSMs, High School Coordinators and High School Director Plan and co-teach grade level college readiness workshops for a small class of high school students with another Mentor Complete 24+ hours of training and at least four hours of professional development during the year Receiving feedback constructively in order to improve performance Tracking and reporting student data Other duties based on the grade level you are assigned WE’RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHO... Can demonstrate experience and results with similar responsibilities to those listed above Is passionate about forming mentoring relationships with students Is passionate about supporting low-income, high-achieving students to earn admission to selective 4-year colleges Is a current college student, graduate student, or recent college graduate based in the New York City area during the academic year Maintains / maintained at least a 3.0 GPA Will respond to email, phone calls, and texts from students and staff within 24 hours Can commit to the entire 2018-19 academic year Is confident with MS Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint in particular), Google Suite, and comfortable learning new systems. Experience with Salesforce or other databases a plus. HIGH SCHOOL/COLLEGE ACCESS MENTOR TENTATIVE CALENDAR... Late August/ Early September - three full days of High School Mentor Training. Mentors can choose either August 17-19 or August 24-26. High School Curriculum Night: August 29. Tentative Professional Development Dates (Mentors should choose at least two to attend) September 12/13 October 16/17 February 20/21 April 23/24 Tentative Super Saturday Dates: September 22 November 10 December 15 February 9 March 23 May 11 Between Super Saturdays: Remotely check in with each of your 12-15 students Plan your lesson for the upcoming Super Saturday Check-in Meeting with assigned High School Coordinator Attend Professional Development Meeting with all HSMs and High School Coordinators June - Complete Mentorship ANTICIPATED TIME COMMITMENT... This mentorship requires approximately 145-160 hours throughout the academic year, including: 24 hours of internship training - August/ September 50 hours of Saturday Programming -6 Saturdays throughout the academic year, 7am-4pm 100 hours of student check-ins - 30 minute check-ins with each student within your cohort of 12-13 following each of the 6 Saturday programs, plus a half hour to report data gathered from each series of check-in’s 12 hours of pre-Saturday lesson planning - About 2 hours of lesson planning per Saturday program 10 hours of professional development support - 1 hour meeting with assigned High School Coordinator between each Saturday program, plus two two-hour sessions chosen by the HSM 2 hours to attend the Fall Curriculum Night 2 hours to attend one night of Seminar (only 9th and 10th grade mentors) COMPENSATION BTNY is strongly believes in selecting the top, qualified candidates. As a part of your offer you can expect to receive the following: A base stipend of $1,750 (High School Mentors - 9th to 11th grade) or $2,250 (College Access Mentors - 12th grade) Candidates can also choose to volunteer their time A pre-paid MetroCard card to cover internship related travel expenses Ongoing professional development support, including PD focused meetings and letters of recommendation TO APPLY Complete the High School Mentor application online (https://tinyurl.com/BTNYMentor2018) by Sunday, July 22 nd at 11:59PM and indicate your interest in CAM where prompted. This application also includes: Resume Current or Most Recent College Transcript (if available) Recommendation Form ( link shared through application, can be completed through August 5 th) If you have any questions, please e-mail seasonal@btny.org
10036.title: Mentor NYC Students!

10036.description: At LiveOn NY, we work to ensure low income older adults in NYC do not have to choose between food and other living expenses. Our Benefits Outreach Center screens older adults for public benefits eligibility and assists them throughout the entire application process. WE ARE LOOKING FOR A SPANISH SPEAKER TO JOIN OUR OFFICE TEAM! SOME OF YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE... Screen older adults to determine eligibility for public benefits Work primarily with non/limited English speaking clients to provide benefits assistance and screening Work directly with Benefits Program Manager and Senior Client Service Coordinator to follow-up with clients and report cases in the database THE IDEAL VOLUNTEER... The ideal volunteer would be fluent in Spanish, have excellent communication skills, and be comfortable working with older adults over the phone. YOUR TIME COMMITMENT WILL BE... 2-3 days/week RECEIVE TRAINING AND SUPPORT! The Benefits Program Manager and Senior Service Client Coordinator will provide ALL necessary training and ongoing support to you. To learn more or to apply, contact Victoria Thornton, vthornton@liveon-ny.org or 212-398-6565 ext 235
10036.title: Office Worker - Spanish Speaker

10036.description: Do you love to teach? Do you want to empower older adults in NYC? Rights and Information for Senior Empowerment (RISE) taps into the energy and momentum of aging by empowering older adults with information on rights, resources, and key policy changes so they can thrive. Our RISE Advocates work to achieve this mission by leading workshops to senior groups on a variety of aging issues including consumer protection, financial fitness and senior scams. We are looking for bilingual speakers to help us with this project, so if you speak Spanish, Cantonese or Mandarin, we would love to have you join the team! Training begins very soon! Next training will be Tuesday, November 6, 2018. For more information or to sign up for the training,
10036.title: Become a RISE Advocate! (bilingual speakers)

10036.description: We are updating SHARE's Breast Cancer Helpline Resource Guide. This very important guide is used internally by Helpline volunteers to assist cancer patients who call SHARE for guidance emotionally, medically, financially, physically, transportation-wise, etc., to name just a few. This project involves making phonecalls, updating database entries, sending emails, and keeping a spreadsheet. We need volunteers who can work in our office any time between 9:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m.
10036.title: Update SHARE Cancer Support's Resource Guide

10036.description: We are looking for a volunteer to help us with tasks related to our upcoming Hope Gala. Our annual Hope Gala will be held on October 17th at Guastavino's. Held annually, the dinner and dance promises to be an unforgettable night marking the celebration of the Foundation's achievements in fighting leukemia and other diseases treatable by bone marrow transplants. We are looking for a volunteer who can work remotely to help us with our Silent Auction portion of the event. Tasks would include: filling out silent auction item request forms, looking into businesses who offer a silent auction donation items, sending letters to businesses requesting items, working with the Development & Events staff and Gala Planning Committee to execute such tasks, and assisting with mailings. This role can be done from home at your best convenience with the option of coming into our NYC office. If you are interested please reach our to Renee, Development and Events Assistant at renee@icla.org
10036.title: Volunteer needed to help with pre-Gala planning

10036.description: Many seniors are disconnected from the vital resources in their own communities. Rights and Information for Senior Empowerment (RISE) works to combat this! We want every senior to feel empowered to access and utilize all the senior services that NYC has to offer. By offering workshops to senior groups on a variety of topics like financial fitness, consumer protection, public benefits, and senior scams, we continue to empower seniors to live their best years! Want to get involved? Get Trained with us! No prior knowledge on these aging issues? No problem! LiveOn NY will provide comprehensive training to all interested volunteers. Elder Abuse & Consumer Protection Volunteer Training Date: Tuesday, August 14 Maximizing Your Financial Resources Volunteer Training Date: Wednesday, August 15 WHAT WOULD YOU DO AS A VOLUNTEER? Volunteers give workshops to seniors groups and caregivers on aging issues including financial fitness, consumer protection, public benefits, and senior scams! Our workshops are hosted all over the five boroughs of New York City. WHAT IS YOUR TIME COMMITMENT? You can create your own volunteer schedule! Volunteers select a minimum of 2-3 events per month. To get involved or to register for the next trainings, contact Victoria Thornton 212-398-6565 ext 235 or vthornton@liveon-ny.org
10036.title: Get Training to Empower Seniors all over NYC!

10036.description: Through LiveOn NY’s Rights and Information for Senior Empowerment (RISE) program, we work to ensure older New Yorkers are informed of policy changes and key resources so that they can live their best later years! We want every older adult to feel empowered to access and utilize all the services that NYC has to offer. We offer workshops & provide vital resources to senior groups on a variety of topics including: financial fitness, consumer protection, public benefits, and senior scams! WHAT WOULD YOU DO? Volunteers give workshops to various audiences of caregivers and older adults on aging issues including financial fitness, consumer protection, public benefits, and senior scams! Our workshops are hosted all over the five boroughs of New York City. TIME COMMITMENT AND TRAINING! You can create your own volunteer schedule! Volunteers select a minimum of 2-3 events per month. No prior knowledge on these aging issues? No problem! LiveOn NY will provide comprehensive training to all interested volunteers! Next Training Sessions: August 14, & 15!! To get involved or register for the next trainings, contact Victoria Thornton 212-398-6565 ext 235 or vthornton@liveon-ny.org
10036.title: Volunteer Advocate!

10036.description: Nearly 1 in 3 older New Yorkers live with the painful, daily choice between food, medicine, and rent. Our Benefits Outreach Center works to ensure they do not have to make this choice by providing screening and application assistance for various public benefits. WE ARE LOOKING FOR A SPANISH SPEAKER TO JOIN OUR TEAM! WHAT WILL YOU DO? Volunteers will help us screen seniors to determine their eligibility for SNAP, SCRIE/DRIE, Medicaid and other public benefits. You will work primarily with non/limited English speaking clients to provide benefits assistance and screening. THE IDEAL VOLUNTEER... The ideal volunteer would be fluent in Spanish, have excellent communication skills, and be comfortable working with older adults over the phone. TIME COMMITMENT AND TRAINING! 2-3 days/week Our Benefits team will provide ALL necessary training and ongoing support to you! To learn more or to apply, contact Victoria Thornton, vthornton@liveon-ny.org or 212-398-6565 ext 235
10036.title: Work To End Hunger for NYC Seniors!

10036.description: At LiveOn NY, we work to ensure low income older adults in NYC do not have to choose between food and other living expenses. Our Benefits Outreach Center screens older adults for public benefits eligibility and assists them throughout the entire application process. We are looking for a Spanish speaker to join our team! SOME OF YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE... Screen older adults to determine eligibility for SNAP, SCRIE/DRIE, Medicaid and other public benefits Work primarily with non/limited English speaking clients to provide benefits assistance and screening Assist clients in completing applications Work directly with Benefits Program Manager and Senior Client Service Coordinator to follow-up with clients and report cases in the database Attend monthly/quarterly meeting with Benefits team THE IDEAL VOLUNTEER... The ideal volunteer would be fluent in Spanish, have prior knowledge of the SNAP and Medicaid programs, have excellent communication skills, and be comfortable working with older adults over the phone. YOUR TIME COMMITMENT WILL BE... 3 days/week RECEIVE TRAINING AND SUPPORT! The Benefits Program Manager and Senior Service Client Coordinator will provide all necessary training and ongoing support to you. BENEFITS FOR VOLUNTEERING WITH US... You will become a valued member of the LiveOn NY Benefits Outreach Center and work to ensure low income older adults has access to vital public benefits. Work towards LiveOn NY’s mission and vision, to make NYC a better place to age. To learn more or to apply, contact Victoria Thornton, vthornton@liveon-ny.org or 212-398-6565 ext 235
10036.title: Benefits Specialist - Spanish Speaker

10036.title: Seeking volunteers committed to our mission for fundraising and events.

10036.description: We're looking for a self starter, ambitious, entrepreneurial and driven individual to join our team this summer in our NYC office and assist with various projects including curating content and managing social media accounts, outreach, research, and database management. This is an unpaid internship. A great opportunity to work with a start up and gain hands-on experience in the education and tech space. Must be social media savvy, organized, with research experience. PERKS: *College credit provided *Cool workspace with free coffee daily
10036.title: Looking for a Social Media/ Admin Intern

10036.description: Do you want to transform the lives of youth and poor communities using the developmental power of performance? Everyday at All Stars, we help young people develop both on stage and off. We do this through six programs, including the All Stars Talent Show Network and the Development School for Youth. Our volunteers come from various professions and personal backgrounds - but what they have in common is the belief that all people should develop in their lives. Our programs enable this, and our people make it possible.
10036.title: Development and Performance for Young People!

10036.description: Help rescue some lunch leftovers from an office in Midtown West! We will deliver the food to Travelers Hotel, located at 274 W 40th street. Mediumweight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is 30-45 pounds.
10036.title: End Food Waste and Feed the Hungry Fridays 3PM!

10036.description: Go the extra mile with Back on My Feet NYC! Dedicated teams of volunteers run 2-4 miles with our members who are transitioning out of homelessness. We encourage runners of all speeds (run/jog/walk) to become a part of our community! Team Times Square runs with the veterans of Samaritan Village on W 43rd Street in between 8th & 9th Avenues every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 5:30-6:30AM. To find out more and sign up for an orientation, visit nyc.backonmyfeet.org/nyc-run-with-us
10036.title: Midtown Morning Runner

10036.description: Fountain House College Re-Entry helps young adults (18-30), who have withdrawn from schoool because of a mental health issue, to develop the knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully reach their educational goals. We are looking for tutors to support our students who have recently returned to school, in various subjects, most commonly math (algebra, stats, pre-calc) and English (essay writing). Tutoring sessions take place at our Center in Hell's Kitchen, Mon-Thurs, 10am-6:30pm, and can be at a regular time each week or by appointment. * We are especially in need of tutors who are available before 5pm, M-F* This is a great opportunity for someone interested in pursuing a career in education/tutoring!
10036.title: Math and Writing Tutors needed!

10036.description: Volunteer and support arts and social justice events and performances.
10036.title: Volunteer with Theatre of the Oppressed NYC

10036.description: BUILD is an innovative, college preparatory program. We use entrepreneurship to ignite the potential of youth from under-resourced communities and propel them to high school, college & career success. Volunteer as a BUILD mentor! BUILD Mentors are placed with a high school student team, coaching them through the process of launching real businesses. This makes school more relevant and fun! Mentors can come from any professional background (entrepreneurship skills are not necessary) - sharing your skill-sets with students inspires them to stay on the path to college success. Interested in getting involved but can’t mentor weekly? BUILD has one-off and group volunteer opportunities as well. Please email NYCVolunteers@BUILD.org for additional information. Here are some details on what a mentoring commitment looks like: Location: Manhattan, Brooklyn or the Bronx Time commitment: 1 hour, once a week (M-Th) (Group options available) Session runs: October 2018 - June 2019 1 mentors assigned per team (1:4 mentor to student ratio) Sites are accessible through public transportation Get started! Fill out our online application here: https://www.tfaforms.com/254886 Got questions? Email us at NYCVolunteers@build.org
10036.title: Empower Youth Entrepreneurs. Be a BUILD Mentor!

10036.description: Flamenco Vivo Carlota Santana, an internationally known flamenco and Spanish dance company is seeking an Intern for 2015. Position Summary: Internship Program Flamenco Vivo Carlota Santana is seeking a current college student, graduate student, or recent college graduate interested in serving as an Intern and providing a wide range of database, research, administrative, and general support to the FVCS administrative team. In return, FVCS will provide an opportunity for the intern to gain experience in and familiarity with areas such as programming, arts in education, marketing and media outreach, fundraising, philanthropy, international development, and the day-to-day operations of a nonprofit organization with a global reach. Minimum commitment requirements vary, however the general term is 6 months for NY residents and on a case-by-case basis for international students. 10 - 15 hours per week is requested depending on the duration of the Internship in exchange for free classes, occasional free workshops and studio time. Internship areas of focus include: Development: The Development Intern assists the Executive and Managing Directors with tasks that vary by season (including support for grant deadlines, end-of-year giving, gala, Artist Advisory Council and Board) and is responsible for entering donations into the database, assisting with program tracking, taking minutes at various meetings and grant/artist opportunity research. Additionally, the ideal candidate possesses a strong interest in engaging Flamenco, contemporary and experimental dance and/or performance work. Experience with Mac software, Word, Excel, and Patronmanager are strongly encouraged. Programming: The Programming Intern works closely with the Programs and Events Coordinator to organize many of the artist programs and events including, but not limited to: the annual FERIA, our Spring Performance Season, arts-in-education residencies, Certamen and our application based programs. Candidates should have experience with Microsoft Excel and Word, excellent writing skills, strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work in a small, busy office environment. Knowledge of PatronManager and Google Docs not required but helpful. Marketing: The Marketing Intern assists the with the social media accounts, press and promotional materials, website maintenance and online class listings. The ideal candidate possesses a strong work ethic, basic organizational skills, and an interest in engaging in Flamenco and other dance classes and events. Attention to detail and strong proofreading skills are a priority. Experience with Patronmanager, Facebook Business Manager, and other media software a plus, in addition to a strong knowledge of social media platforms such as Facebook,Twitter, and Instagram. Media: The Media Intern assists with the video archive and database, press and promotional materials, website maintenance and social media. The ideal candidate possesses a strong work ethic, organizational skills, and an interest in the documentation of Flamenco, contemporary, and experimental dance. Experience with Mac software and Excel are strongly encouraged. Experience with, iMovie, Final Cut Pro X, After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator and/or social media platforms a plus. Responsibilities include: Answering phones and providing information Taking rental and class payments Running errands Assisting with bulk mailings Helping maintain operations and facilities Customer Care Greeting guests in a warm, enthusiastic and helpful manner Working as a team with the staff and other interns to provide outstanding and consistent customer service Enforcing all policies and procedures for use of the spaces: be fair and firm Awareness at all times of what is happening in the studios Providing formal or informal orientations and answering questions for new visitors Providing immediate and thoughtful responses to customer requests Being responsive and pro-active in meeting renters’ needs Accommodating the creative needs of clients through operational solutions that safeguard and protect the space Assisting in the maintenance of a robust client database by capturing relevant details such as customer preferences and referral sources Facilities Management Assisting with facility operations and maintenance Implementing maintenance timetables and checklists Establishing and enforcing basic \"set up\" for each studio Ensuring standard inventory of products, equipment and supplies Conducting Rounds, Runs and Routines at specified intervals Assisting in the maintenance of strong relationships with location’s building staff Requirements Applicants must commit to 15 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months. Exceptions may be made for academic credit. Must be proficient in a Mac environment Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, social networking sites, Photoshop, and Illustrator a must Video editing skills using Final Cut Pro, iMovie etc. Excellent writing skills Priority will be given to those with experience in dance administration who are pursuing or have completed their college education Benefits Invaluable knowledge and experience working in a top Flamenco Company Connections and relationships with the local and international dance community unlimited Flamenco Vivo classes and access to discounted and free rehearsal space for their own artistic exploration. Personal recommendation letters To apply, please submit your dance and administrative resume along with your cover letter, three references, a sample of edited photo or video, and a writing sample. Once applications are screened, an interview will be scheduled.Flamenco Vivo is committed to supporting and valuing the great diversity of our multicultural city and dance field. People of color are encouraged to apply.
10036.title: Arts Administration Internship with Flamenco Vivo Carlota Santana

10036.description: Supervisor: Helpline Manager Position Summary: Information and Referral Helpline volunteers will offer information and treatment options to callers and answer basic questions regarding body image and eating disorders in a caring and compassionate manner. This position is a great learning opportunity and involves a minimum of 15 hours of training. Primary Responsibilities: 1. Information and Referral Services: Provide positive, respectful and timely responses regarding eating disorder information requests via incoming phone calls, voicemail messages, emails, forums, instant messages, and social media sites under Helpline responsibility. Ensure the distribution of Helpline information and treatment options in a timely manner that fits the needs of the individual and is presented in a professional manner. Compose general letters of response for information requests. Develop skills related to database management. Increase knowledge and understanding concerning eating disorders and how to appropriately support those affected by them. When deemed appropriate by the Helpline Supervisor, serve as a mentor in the training of newer Helpline volunteers and interns. Contribute to the association’s mission of eliminating eating disorders and body dissatisfaction. 2. Program Duties: Assist Program department staff with ongoing educational and outreach projects. Required Qualifications: High energy, positive attitude, and enthusiasm. Meticulous attention to detail and strong organizational skills. Excellent communication skills and demonstrated ability to provide quality customer service. Strong computer skills, data entry and word-processing ability. Must be dependable and self-motivated. Able to work effectively as an individual and as part of a team. Recovery is important to us here at NEDA. We require that applicants with personal experience who are interested in getting involved with the National Eating Disorders Association have two years of strong recovery due to the intense and triggering nature of this position.
10036.title: Helpline Volunteer/Intern

10036.description: Lar Lubovitch and the Board of Directors are pleased to invite you to join the newly formed Junior Board of the Lar Lubovitch Dance Company. Membership on the Junior Board offers a unique opportunity to personally participate in the organization of this prestigious New York dance company. A short list of the benefits includes the following: -Invitations to special junior board member events throughout the year. -Attendance at private rehearsals with dancers and choreographer. -Access to a backstage experience and a chance to meet the dancers. -Acknowledgement and listed by name in all printed programs. -Priority seating for friends purchasing Gala tickets. -Involvement in the planning and staging of dance events To join the Junior Board, each member undertakes the responsibility of a $250 membership per year plus the commitment of selling 5 Gala tickets to the company’s principal event of the season.
10036.title: Seeking Junior Board Members

10036.description: UX is a development institution that is forward thinking, free of cost, and open to people of all ages. It is a new crossroads for learning. The whole city is its campus. It takes place at the All Stars Project headquarters on 42nd St. and it also takes place in corporate boadrooms and back stage at Broadway theatres, in your neighborhood and at your school, even in your living room if you want it to. It has no tuition and no grades. We are looking for mature adults of all ages, open-minded thinkers, self-starters with organization and planning skills. Good oral and written communication skills. Administrative skills; including but not limited to: Microsoft Suite & Database management. Willingness to travel throughout N.Y.C.'s five boroughs. Some evening and weekend availability a plus.
10036.title: UX - Volunteer

10036.description: Flamenco Vivo Carlota Santana We believe that the universal spirit of flamenco, a multicultural art form, has the power to build bridges between cultures. Artistic Director Carlota Santana leads this company of energetic dancers and musicians in: powerful performances extensive community outreach Volunteers: Work- Study Program Flamenco Vivo’s Work- Study program provides students with the opportunity to work in exchange for free Flamenco Vivo classes and studio rental. Duties include customer service such as checking-in students, handling cash payments and maintaining student records, as well as general office work such as cleaning, relaying messages and providing basic information to the public. Cleaning or maintenance duties require late and early hours of work. Requirements Applicants must reside in NYC and commit to a minimum of 3 months Proficiency in English (Spanish a plus) Prior experience in customer service a must Excellent organizational skills and the ability to multitask with detailed accuracy in a fast-paced environment Proficiency in a Mac and PC environment with Microsoft Word and Excel Benefits Students working a minimum of 6 hours per week will receive a class card for every 3 hours worked.
10036.title: Flamenco Vivo Work/Study Program

10036.description: Youth Onstage! offers young people, ages 14 to 21, the opportunity to perform in and create plays that have something to say about the world and its future. During its first four years, YO! has produced hip-hop cabarets, poetry snaps, and plays by first-time youth writers. All productions are performance experiments, designed to challenge its performers and audiences to think and feel outside of the box. They tackle difficult social and political issues and create an environment in which contemporary urban youth can express their experiences and perspectives to a diverse audience of adults and youth from New York City and beyond. Young people can get involved in YO! by applying to the free after-school performance training program, an integrated course of intensive performance classes volunteer teachers with pofessional theater training. Theater professionals are needed to teach various improvisation and technical classes during the Fall, Spring, or Summer. The Fall and Spring schedule is a ten week program that meets once a week for 90 minute classes. The Summer program runs four times a week for 60 minute classes. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=81rqVwzzcbs&feature=channel
10036.title: Youth Onstage Faculty

10036.description: The Marketing, Sales and Public Relations Department is seeking various interns to work with and be trained by Gail Peck, the Sales Director of the All Stars, Inc. This department works closely with the Castillo Theater, the dynamic home of cutting- edge improvisational, black, social, political, and avant-garde theater that features the work of playwrights from Germany and Martinique as well as Bed- Stuy and the Bronx. Responsibilities: sending out press releases and inviting the press for shows, database up-keep and entry, making sales calls to theater patrons, internet research to make new connections, PR (putting together lists of PR outlets/magazines), etc.
10036.title: Marketing and Sales Intern/ Volunteer

10036.description: The Office of the President is currently recruiting six interns for Fall 2008. Interns will gain valuable hands- on experience in the non- profit sector and will have the opportunity to work with a variety of community organizers and philanthropists. Responsibilities: track the president's written correspondence, produce Board of Directors' meetings, organize special events, maintain large donor databases/files, answer president's telephone line, etc.
10036.title: Intern for the Office of the President

10036.description: Work with our dynamic Sales and Marketing Director to promote a variety of All Stars productions -- from Hip-Hop Cabarets to avante garde drama to community open houses. Work includes targeting various constituencies through online media and phone outreach. Creative ideas and campaigns are welcomed. Day time hours are best.
10036.title: Volunteer Theatre Sales Support

10036.description: The Lar Lubovitch Dance Company is world-renowned. We currently have 14 dedicated members on our Senior Board, and we are now seeking to add 3 or 4 more lovers of dance to our circle of supporters. Prospective board members should have an appreciation of dance and be willing to work with other like-minded professionals, helping the company realize its mission. The commitment of time and money are both very reasonable -- while the emotional and spiritual rewards are enormous. We would be very happy to meet with you and let you see what we are all about. Please contact us at your earliest convenience.
10036.title: Seeking Senior Board Members

10036.description: Looking for caring adults to volunteer to support an innovative performance and development program that involves more than 10,000 young people in New York City each year. In the \"All Stars Talent Show,\" every young person who auditions makes it into the show. Adult and youth volunteers work together to conduct community outreach and help produce auditions, workshops and shows. Our \"Center for Youth Development\" on West 42nd Street is the producing headquarters for these off-site productions, which take place in inner-city communities throughout New York City.
10036.title: Inner-City Youth Talent Show Support Staff

10036.description: Castillo Theatre Production Volunteer - A showplace for the plays of Fred Newman and Heiner Muller, a multicultural home for Black theatre, and a hotbed of theatrical improvisation, Castillo includes people of all ages and backgrounds in its creative life. Embarking on its 32nd season, The award winning Castillo Theater brings socially relevant theatre, dealing with contemporary and historical social issues to the heart of New York's commercial theatre district. Volunteers are needed to support all aspects of the theatre. marketing and sales,set design, costumes, wardrobe, lighting, sound, stage management, box office, house staff,theatre administration, audience development, and much more! Most positions will train. Schedules are varied and flexible; however, for some technical positions in the theatre a stable, reliable schedule is essential. Some evening and weekend availability needed.
10036.title: Castillo Theatre Production Volunteer

08835.description: The Arc of Somerset County provides quality services and advocacy for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families to support development and achievement at every stage of life. We currently serve over 1,400 individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities and their families annually. The Arc of Somerset County's Human Resources Department is looking for a volunteer who can assist with administrative work such as scanning for our electronic filing system, filing paperwork, mailings, etc. Individuals can volunteer during weekday business hours and some weekends.
08835.title: Human Resources Department Needs Assistance!

08835.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
08835.title: Manville, NJ: Autism Volunteer

08836.description: Help provide emergency first aid, rescue, and transport services to those in need in Martinsville and the Washington Valley section of Bridgewater. A great way to learn about emergency services and healthcare while helping others in your community during their time of greatest need. Volunteer for either daytime or nighttime service. We will provide you with all necessary training, mentoring, and equipment at no cost to you. Applicants must be at least 18 years old. Please call 732-469-1505 or e-mail us at mrsquad@verizon.net for more information.
08836.title: Ambulance Driver

08836.description: Help provide emergency first aid, rescue, and transport services to those in need in Martinsville and the Washington Valley section of Bridgewater. A great way to learn about emergency services and healthcare while helping others in your community during their time of greatest need. Volunteer for either daytime or nighttime service. We will provide you with all necessary training, mentoring, and equipment at no cost to you. Applicants must be at least 18 years old. 10003.description: **** To sign up go to https://www.hungervolunteer.org/civicrm/vol/#/volunteer/opportunities?project=711&hideSearch=1 Hunger Free America sends out an annual survey to over 700 soup kitchens and food pantries in New York City to assess how hunger in the city changes from year to year and what additional resources they might need. We need volunteers to assist in executing the survey, make follow-up phone calls with these organizations to encourage them to complete the survey, and offer to go through the questions together on the phone, as well as enter data into survey software. This is Hunger Free America's biggest data gathering event of the year and the results guide our work forward for the following year! Your time and help are critical to our success! Dates and times are flexible to your schedule. We will contact you to discuss scheduling upon commitment. **You must be in the NYC area to come to our downtown office for a brief training. **
10003.title: Help us collect food insecurity data in NYC

10003.description: Hunger Free America sends out an annual survey to over 700 soup kitchens and food pantries in New York City to assess how hunger in the city changes from year to year and what additional resources they might need. We need volunteers to assist in executing the survey, make follow-up phone calls with these organizations to encourage them to complete the survey, and offer to go through the questions together on the phone, as well as enter data into survey software. Our office is conveniently located in downtown Manhattan, near multiple train lines. Come by after work and help with Hunger Free America's biggest data gathering event of the year and the results guide our work forward for the following year! Your time and help are critical to our success!
10003.title: Help gather food insecurity data in NYC

10003.description: About Mano a Mano: Mexican Culture Without Borders is proud to return to St. Mark's Church-in-the-Bowery for three days of programming for this important Mexican holiday. We need people who are interested in helping to build the altar, help with crafts workshops, join in processions, help with dramatic and musical presentations and help interpret this creative and meaningful installation for the community. General times for which we need volunteers on St Mark's Church in-the-Bowery 131 East 10th Street, 2nd Avenue are: October 26, 2018 2:00 pm to 8:00 pm October 28, 2018 10:00 am to 8:00 pm Volunteer Posts Needed Information Table- Check people in, give them a program and information on the altar and event when needed Altar Building Team- We need a group of people to help us set up the main altar on Thursday, October 31 starting at 1 pm and usually ending around 7 pm. Set Up Team- Every day we need to put up banners, decorations, chairs and tables, open the altar and fix anything that needs fixing Break Down Team- The same way we need to set up we need to break down every night. Taking down banners, decorations, chairs, tables and making sure the altar is secure for the night. Workshop Helpers- We need people to help guide the attendees on how to do the hands on workshops, this year we will have two flower workshops and a face painting station. In exchange for all your very need help we promise to give you a great experience and to feed you warm yummy Mexican Food!
10003.title: Day of the Dead Festival in East Village (Oct 26-28)
10003.org: Mano a Mano: Mexican Culture Without Borders

10003.description: GO Project Spanish Translator (Saturday Volunteer) GO Project: Who We Are and What We Do The GO Project shapes the futures of low-income New York City public school children by providing critical academic, social and emotional support starting in the early elementary years. GO provides year-round educational and family support services to children who are performing below grade level and equips them with the confidence and skills needed to succeed at school, at home and in life. GO School Programming: How YOU Can Help GO School is a focused, seven-month Saturday program with a staff of certified teachers and skilled volunteer tutors. Students attend on Saturdays between October and April for a half-day of focused academic skill-building. Professional teachers lead lessons, support volunteer tutors, and communicate with parents to keep them informed about their child’s progress. Volunteer tutors commit to a semester of volunteering in a classroom and mentor their students to provide consistent and individualized needed to succeed. Volunteer translators provide critical communication support between our GO families and our staff. Interpreters are responsible for translating English into Spanish in order for our program to communicate with our families regarding program updates and their child’s academic & social-emotional progress/needs. Specific Translator duties will include: Saturdays Assist with parent meetings, workshops and orientations for Spanish speaking families. Provide interpretation for our families, including any cultural/linguistic references that may need to be explained. Maintain our families’ right to confidentiality. Collaborate with GO Staff, Volunteer Manager, Head Teachers and GO Families Staff to address and respond to our students’/ families’ needs. Time Commitment Session I: October-December 2018; 9 Saturdays from 9:00AM-12:45PM Session II: January-April 2019; 13 Saturdays from 9:00AM-12:45PM Attend mandatory orientation and training prior to start of session. *You can choose to be a Committed Volunteer to come each Saturday with 3 allowed absences per session, or a Floater Volunteer to come on the Saturdays that you are available. GO School Fall 2018 Session I Oct 13, 20, 27 Nov 3, 10, 17 Dec 1, 8, 5 GO School Spring 2019 Session II Jan 5, 12, 26 Feb 2, 9, 23 March 2, 9, 16, 23 April 6, 13, 27 Locations You can choose to tutor our students at one of the following 6 locations: Manhattan Locations Avenues: The World School (1st-3rd Grade): 259 10th Avenue, between 25th and 26th Streets Grace Church School (1st-5th Grade): 86 4th Avenue, between 10th and 11th Streets Grace Church High School (6th-8th Grade): 46 Cooper Square, at 6th Street LREI (1st-5th Grade): 272 6th Avenue, at the corner of Bleecker Street St. Luke’s School (1st-5th Grade): 487 Hudson Street, at Hudson and Christopher Streets Brooklyn Location Berkeley Carroll (1st-3rd Grade): 701 Carroll Street, between 6th and 7th Avenues Placement is based on a complimentary match between programmatic need and volunteer strengths. We will honor preferences when possible. Qualifications: Ability to speak Spanish fluently. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Interest in strength-based collaborative work, education and social services. Prior experience in simultaneous and consecutive interpretation is a plus. Personal Attributes: The ideal candidate is exceptionally intelligent, warm, engaging and energetic. He or she also: Sees the possibilities as opposed to the obstacles and is creative and tenacious in solving problems. Enjoys working with others in a collaborative, creative environment. Has a strong work ethic and high standards for his/her own work and the work of others; is flexible and has a lively sense of humor. Benefits: How Can We Help YOU Personal gratification through enhancing the lives of young learners. Ongoing professional development and training opportunities. Leadership opportunities for sustained dedication and commitment. Being part of a vibrant and diverse volunteer community. How to Apply Application Form Cover Letter/Personal Statement explaining why you want to volunteer with the GO Project Resume (for volunteers 18 and older)/ High school transcript (for HS students) Personal reference Background check (for those 18 and older) The application form for GO School 2018-2019 volunteers can be found here: https://goo.gl/forms/bkZrxbtMwZafVukT2 If you have any questions or would like more information about the available volunteer positions, please contact volunteering@goprojectnyc.org or call 347-377-2318 ATTN: Charlotte Karol, Community Engagement & Volunteer Coordinator.
10003.title: Saturday Spanish Translators Needed!
