Matches are based on volunteer availability and geographic location. Our office is located in Flushing and we service the areas of College Point, Bayside, Whitestone, and Flushing. * We currently in need of KOREAN, GREEK, ITALIAN, SPANISH, RUSSIAN, and AMERICAN SIGN LANGUAGE (ASL) speakers! REQUIREMENTS: Volunteers must be 18 or older. An interview, training, references, and background check are required. COMMITMENT: Weekly hour-long visits for a minimum of 6 months. DAY & TIME: Flexible LOCATION (may vary): 45-25 Kissena Boulevard Flushing, NY 11355
11355.title: Friendly Visiting Volunteers Needed!

11355.description: Do you love to plan events? Are you creative, organized and a team player? We need your skills! We are looking for volunteers to join our Event Planning Committee to help plan our annual gala and other special events. Some responsibilities include Planning and executing logistics of the event Assisting with event marketing and promotions Soliciting sponsorship contributions and auction items Working as an event volunteer the day of and ensuring the event’s overall success Work with the Executive Director and the Board to identify prospects and relationships Desired Skills, Interests and/or Education: Event planning experience Fundraising experience Donor and relationship management experience Experience working with nonprofits and volunteers Think you are the right fit for the position? Send us your resume and cover letter to admin@thebridgetolife.org with the subject line 'Event Planning Committee Member'
11355.title: Event Planning Committee Member

11355.description: Are you creative, self-motivated, and have experience fundraising? Have you had experience writing grants for nonprofit organizations? Maybe you're a people person, and love to network. If so, this may be just the opportunity for you! Bridge Women's Support Center is looking for a Grant Writer/Fundraising Assistant volunteer who is enthusiastic and self-motivated. This person will assist with grant writing, connecting and networking with local businesses, and increasing fundraising efforts. The position reports to our Executive Director, who primarily works in our Flushing office. Hours are flexible and the position some work can be done remotely if needed. To apply, please send an email to admin@thebridgetolife.org with a resume and a brief description of why you are interested in volunteering. Please note \"Development Assistant/Grant Writer\" in your email’s subject line.
11355.title: Grant Writer/Fundraising Assistant

11354.description: At Rescuing Leftover Cuisine, we aim to feed the hungry and reduce food waste. To connect food providers to the hungry of New York City, we need all the help we can get in transporting leftover food. Rescuers help bring food from our partners to a local homeless shelter. It takes less than an hour and you can set your own schedule, whether you want to help out daily, weekly, or sporadically. Our events at Rescuing Leftover Cuisine typically last 30 minutes (some events are longer, some are shorter). We have a few different options for volunteering with us depending on how much time you can commit: 1. Sporadic: To sign up sporadically for events that work for your schedule, follow the below video on this page to create an account and get started! 2.Emergency Rescuer: Can't make a weekly commitment but want to be notified of opportunities near you? Join as an Emergency Rescuer, and you can let us know when generally you'd be available and we will text you to alert you of opportunities near you as they come up! 3. Lead Rescuer: A Lead Rescuer is a volunteer who leads others on food rescue events, takes attendance, and reports the number of pounds of food rescued. All of our food rescue events are led by one, and they ensure that the rescued food arrives at its destination safely. Lead Rescuers are trained and must attend an orientation session. They commit at least 1 hour a week for at least 4 months. Lead Rescuers also receive letters of participation on RLC's letterhead for proof of volunteering. 4. Core Rescuer: A volunteer who leads others on five food rescue events per week. RLC will provide you with an unlimited monthly Metrocard in exchange. 5. Rescuer Associate: A volunteer who leads others on ten food rescue events per week. RLC will pay you $8 per food rescue event. We have food rescue events in Manhattan, Brooklyn & Queens anytime from 8am-11pm. Each day has an average of 75 events that need food rescuers! If interested or if you want more details, please email melinda@rescuingleftovercuisine.org
11354.title: REDUCE FOOD WASTE & FEED THE HUNGRY

11354.description: Queens Historical Society is seeking docents on a volunteer basis in assisting with various roles of the organization. The role of a docents at QHS will be to act as a tour guide of the Kingsland Homestead, headquarters of the Queens Historical Society, by educating our visitors on the history of the house and the family who lived in it. In addition, docents must also provide information about any current events and exhibits. The candidate must have availability to volunteer once or twice a month on Saturdays and/or Sundays, occasional Tuesdays from 2:30 to 4:30pm. Duties will consist of greeting guests, taking admission fees, and tours. It’s important to arrive at least ten minutes before the museum is scheduled to open. Responsibilities: Greet visitors when they enter Kingsland Homestead and encourage them to sign in our visitor log. Collect admission fee, and become familiar with cash/credit transactions. Provide visitors with information on how they can sign up for membership with QHS, as well as the benefits of becoming a member. Offer a guided or self-guided tour of the house but to always accompany visitors to the second floor. Encourage visitors to shop at our gift shop, which offers a wide variety of education about the history of Queens. Complete a Docent Form at the end of volunteer shift that will be kept in the visitor log book. Must follow all rules and procedures.
11354.title: Museum Tour Guide

11354.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Queens and Nassau County: John Clinton, Volunteer Coordinator; 347-578-2123 or JCLINTON@MJHS.ORG
11354.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer in Queens!

11354.description: Looking for warm compassionate persons to provide companionship and emotonal support to terminally ill patients. Patient care volunteers visit patients in Nursing homes, assisted living or in patient's own homes. All Volunteers will be provided training, supervision and support. Hospice volunteers: Visit patients in their homes and in facilities offering companionship and a chance to reminisce Read books, newspapers and other favorites to people when they aren’t able themselves Contribute to volunteer newsletter keeping volunteers and staff in tune with the Hospice Volunteer Program’s activities Assist with small errands for the patient and family to supplement the care received at home Share their talents and gifts... Play Music, create photo albums Provide patient the opportunity to tell his/her life story through the use of video, (if patient or caregiver has one available), audio and/or the written word. Office Volunteers assist office staff with basic tasks such as copying and filing, helping with web research, spreadsheets and more.
11354.title: Queens Patient Care Volunteer
11354.org: Caring Hospice Services of New York

08837.description: Canine Companions for Independence has an opening for an Event Chair and DogFest committee to lead the planning of the 2018 DogFest New Jersey Walk N Roll. Event Chair must be available to meet once a month for committee meetings and have ability to assist committee members in soliciting sponsors, recruiting teams and participants and publicizing the event. Position description is below but subject to change. Event Chair candidates will need to connect with Canine Companions staff before being approved for the position. DogFest Chairperson Work with Staff Partner to identify and recruit Committee Chairs. With the Committee Chairs, recruit volunteers to fill committee positions. Manage the committee through the planning process. Communicate with Staff Partner to ensure they are in the loop through the entire process. Serve as spokesperson for DogFest in the community Organization and communication skills to coordinate and lead committee meetings Have a well-developed network of potential sponsors, vendors and committee members Creativity to come up with ideas for fund-raising Ability to participate in meetings during work days and evenings both by phone and face to face in Irving Follow up skills needed to keep various committee info updated and on track Passion for the cause because it will come out in the message presented Ability and willingness to speak in public meetings and at Canine Companions events to promote DogFest and drive committee membership and event participation Ability to assist committee in soliciting sponsorships, recruiting teams and participants and publicizing event Previous event planning and fundraising experience helpful
08837.title: Dogfest Walk 'n Roll Chairperson or commitee member
08837.org: CANINE COMPANIONS FOR INDEPENDENCE - NORTHEAST REGION (Maine to Virginia)

08837.description: Akhil Autism Foundation looking for volunteers who are passionate about teaching have some experience with special need children They will be teaming with parents and teach various subjects from grade level 1 to High school or higher or topics as per the students like. Its a no paid job at present can become paid in future depending how it goes. open minded reading to learn new learning style, passionate about working and analysing the individuals learning style. contact manishaladnc@gmail.com
08837.title: Tutors needed special need children in NJ

08837.description: We are in need of a research assistant to help out in our fundraising efforts. Basic internet research and data entry. Research will be compiled into an Excel spreadsheet. Time is flexible. We will work with your schedules.
08837.title: Research assistant needed to help out with fundraising for local educational nonprofit!

08837.description: JANJ is looking for an eager volunteer to perform administrative duties to assist our staff in our Edison office. Responsibilities include: -entering data into our system -copying and organizing event paperwork -mailing documents -ordering food for events -assisting wherever needed Qualifications: -computer literacy -tech savvy -organized
08837.title: Our Programs team needs an administrative assistant who loves to type!

08837.description: JANJ is looking for an eager volunteer to assist our program managers in running our High School Heroes and corporate events. Responsibilities include: -travelling to JANJ events -pairing volunteers with classes -organizing lunch for volunteers -taking photos and gathering quotes for our social media accounts -addressing volunteer inquiries Qualifications: -organized -a passion for interacting with elementary, middle, and high schoolers -knowledge of social media platforms -tech savvy
08837.title: Volunteer Program Associate

08837.description: We are a non-profit looking for positive-minded adult volunteers of all ages to help with various data-entry projects for our growing organization. The hours are flexible - come when you can, stay as long as you like - just let us know. We need talents of all types from data entry savvy volunteers to research and development and everything in between. Join us in our exciting new Education Center in Raritan Center Business Park in Edison and meet our wonderful staff who are dedicated to our mission of empowering young people to own their economic success. Learn more about us at www.janj.org
08837.title: Do you like to type? Data Entry help needed for local education nonprofit

08837.description: We are a non profit organization dedicated to autism. we need a media promotion manager to work as probono initially which can turn into paid position. we need someone to make 1. our promotional videos 2. record our programs, events, workshops and our project work 3. help us design the video content for fundraising 4. video content of our webinars for our website 5. general video recording of our online education please contact manishaladnc@gmail.com
08837.title: Media Promotion manager

08837.description: Looking for Veterans who wish to Volunteer to visit/companionship with Veterans who are currently on Caring Hospice service.
08837.title: Veteran Volunteers

08837.description: Participate in activities such as: Companionship/Patient Visits, Talent Sharing Patient Visits - play music, work on art projects, Helping Hands patient Visits - grocery shop, relieve caregiver and Office work
08837.title: Office and Field Volunteers

08837.description: The Mobile Family Success Center of Middlesex County provides FREE educational and fun activities to the community. We serve all of Middlesex County but focus on East Brunswick, Edison, North Brunswick, Piscataway, and Sayreville. We are currently seeking volunteers to lead workshops, crafts, and classes. All of our activities center around our core services that include Health, Parent/Child Activities & Parent Education, Employment, Housing, Life Skills, Advocacy, and Information & Referral. We have some specific workshop & activity ideas in mind but are open to any and all ideas and offers. Below are some activities we currently conduct or hope to conduct with the right volunteer: Health related workshops geared toward youth/adults/seniors Easy, healthy recipe demonstrations Cupcake/Cookie decorating demos Crafts/Games/Workshops for parents & children or seniors Self Defense/Safety tips for eldery/adult/children Please visit our website and social media pages to see our monthly calendars and activities. http://www.ccdom.org/mfscmiddlesex https://www.facebook.com/MFSCMiddlesex https://twitter.com/MFSCMiddlesex
08837.title: Workshop Leaders Needed

08837.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Grace Healthcare Services welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. We are currently in need of Office volunteers! Our office is open Monday-Friday between the hours of 8:00 am - 5:00 pm. Our Administrative/Office Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by filing, organizing, creating folders, organizing newsletters, collating manuals and participating in special projects. You will get to work very closely with our compassionate staff, creating bonds while gaining valuable hospice insight. For more information about our volunteer opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com! We look forward to hearing from you!
08837.title: Office Volunteers Needed!

08837.description: We are a non-profit looking for positive-minded adult volunteers of all ages to help with various projects for our growing organization. The hours are flexible - come when you can, stay as long as you like - just let us know. We need talents of all types from research enthusiasts to data entry savvy volunteers and everything in between. Join us in our exciting new Education Center in Raritan Center Business Park in Edison and meet our wonderful staff who are dedicated to our mission of empowering young people to own their economic success. Learn more about us at www.janj.org
08837.title: Can you help with research, data entry, mailings or office work?  We need you!

08837.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08837.title: Adult Mentor

08690.description: Ascend Hospice is looking for individuals who are willing to share some of their time in bringing a little joy to others who are now at the end of their lives. All of us have gifts to share. Whether it be offering companionship by conversation, holding someone's hand, playing music, reading to them or just making them feel special. We ask you to share an hour or two a week, more if you're able to provide comfort and caring to those who will provide you with much more than you will ever imagine. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki, massage therapy and/or reflexology practitioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. These practices have proven to be beneficial during end-of-life care assisting with anxiety, emotional release and general comfort which is instrumental to patients and their families. Certification is required and hospice training is provided. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ or in South Jersey - Bright and Beautiful Therapy Dogs - see website here http://www.golden-dogs.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com. We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
08690.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki/Massage Therapy - Hamilton Township

08690.description: Seasons Hospice and Palliative Care of NJ is actively recruiting Music Therapy Volunteers who like to sing and/or play an instrument to join our music therapy program. Use your musical gifts today to bring joy to our patients. Whether you are a vocalist or play an instrument, you can bring the joy of music to patients and their loved ones for comfort and relaxation. Music can calm and stir imaginations bringing back wonderful memories. Each volunteer receives orientation, training and wonderful support from our caring staff. We appreciate and celebrate your musical gifts and talents! Share your gift today! Extending beyond the borders of traditional healthcare, we treat the whole person and their loved ones in ways that touch the human spirit ~ adding days to life and life to days. ***New Acoustic Program launched! Do you play acoustic guitar, harp or violin? Join this special team providing environmentally friendly music. WE NEED YOU!! We are currently looking for We Honor Veterans volunteers in Monmouth, Middlesex, Somerset, Camden and Mercer Counties!
08690.title: Music Volunteers are needed to join our team!  Seasons Hospice & Palliative Care
08690.org: Seasons Hospice and Palliative Care of New Jersey

08690.description: Seasons Hospice and Palliative Care of New Jersey is currently seeking friendly, well-mannered dogs of all shapes and sizes to join our Loyal Friends Pet Team. Pets must be therapy certified through Therapy Dogs International or another licensed, insured pet therapy program. These special, loving, animals and their owners are needed to provide much needed companionship and comfort to our patients and their families. Our opportunities are flexible and based upon your availability. Pet Team Volunteers serve both patients and families in the home and/or nursing facility within a area of the volunteer's choosing. Typically once trained, a Pet Team Volunteer visits one time per week on a schedule that works best for the Pet Team and patient. Become a Loyal Friends Pet Team Volunteer! We are currently looking for Loyal Friends Pet Team volunteers In Monmouth, Middlesex, Somerset, and Mercer Counties! Please connect with me, Vellus Campbell, Volunteer Service Coordinator, at 609-570-4800, or vcampbell@seasons.org, for more information! Thank You!
08690.title: Pet Team Volunteer - Leave your Paw Print on the World!
08690.org: Seasons Hospice and Palliative Care of New Jersey

08690.description: Nature Abounds, a national 501c3 non-profit organization, is looking for senior aged volunteers (55 yrs of age) to serve as Environmental Science Teachers onboard the Steamboat Floating Classroom (SPLASH), or on land, adjacent to steamboat dock. Environmental Science classes include: Enviroscape/Watershed Studies; Chemistry of the River; Shad Migration and the Environmental History of the Delaware River; Macroinvertebrates. Most classes are 3 rd grade through 6 th grade, some classes are older. Class size: 8 to 12. Class is taught 3 times per trip. Availability: Trips are by charter arrangement. Most trips are Monday-Friday, with departure times of 10am and 12:30pm. Teachers need to arrive approximately 45 minutes before departure time, to set up teaching station. Season starts in early May and ends in October. Trip schedule is available online, science teachers can indicate their availability to teach in the online document, or email the trip scheduler. Responsibilities: Set up teaching station; Dry and put away teaching materials after the trip. Training: Lesson plans provided. Training arranged with Education Director. Qualifications: Passion for sharing environmental science with young people. Sense of adventure and fun. A background check is required.
08690.title: Environmental Science Teacher

08690.description: Pet therapy is proven to provide therapeutic effects and elicit positive emotions. If you enjoy showing off your pet and spending time with others, then Pet Therapy is the project for you. If you own a pet and know your animal can bring joy to everyone, please bring them along to make friends with the residents. This is a fun and popular project that is great for your whole family. Although, pets DO NOT have to be \"certified\", all pets must have proof of an up to date rabies vaccination. Please bring a copy of this certificate to keep on file. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
08690.title: Pet Therapy in Hamilton

08831.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
08831.title: Monroe, NJ: Autism Volunteer

08831.description: Greenwood House Hospice is a non-profit, non-sectarian hospice providing medical and nursing services, social workers, spiritual support, and volunteers to enhance the quality of living for those with terminal diagnosis. We serve patients in the Monroe area and are currently in need of compassionate and caring volunteers. There are many rewarding volunteer opportunities available. Training and support is provided. Activities may include patient and family visits, companionship and/or telephone calls; social and sensory stimulation for patients; crafts or handmade items for distribution; musician volunteers; office/clerical support; assistance with our bereavement program.
08831.title: Patient Contact Volunteer

08831.description: Marketplace in Jamesburg is a great opportunity for volunteers to impact the lives of families in the community. The Deacon’s Food Cupboard provides food allotments that include perishable and non-perishable items, to over 80 families every month. Volunteers are needed to help distribute food to families in need. Help fight hunger today! NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
08831.title: Marketplace in Jamesburg

10552.description: If you have an animal that has been through a traning program to do Pet Therapy we would love to have you come and visit our residents in our nursing home, assisted living facility or our Adult Day Care.
10552.title: Friendly Visiting with your Pet

10552.description: We are looking for presenters to come and stimulate alert senior citizens with an interesting hobby and knowledge of different subjects that would stimulate discussion. The presenter would need to feel comfortable speaking to a group of 20 or more.
10552.title: Guest Lecturer

10552.description: Each Sunday residents from our assisted living and our nursing home would like to attend chapel services in our Lutheran church but they need someone to bring them to the chapel. We are looking for people to wheel them over to the chapel. We start transporting at 9:45 for at 10:30 service.
10552.title: WOW  Worship on Wheels

10552.description: Our physical therapy and occupational therapy department at the Waltemade Nursing Care Center need people to help transport the residents to their therapy sessions.
10552.title: Rehab Transporters

10552.description: Assist residents in our Waltemade Nursing Care Center and our Adult Day Care with their meals. Some need help cutting the food while others may need help eating. Breakfast, lunch and dinner at the Waltemade and lunch at the Adult Day Care.
10552.title: Mealtime Assistant

10552.description: Visit our residents in the Waltemade Nursing Care Center, or the Meadowview Assisted Living building or our Adult Care Center. Talk to them about current events, their families, play games with them, do crossword puzzles, whatever makes them happy.
10552.title: Friendly Visitor

10552.description: Many offices in our facilities such as medical billing, finance, HR, Nursing office, and Home Care that need help with filing, sorting mail and more.
10552.title: Clerical Worker

10552.description: We have two gift shops, one at the Waltemade Nursing Care Center and the other at the Meadowview Assisted Living building that sell candy, stamps and knick knacks for the residents.
10552.title: Gift Shop Attendant

10552.description: Either assist or run our Bingo, Pokeno or many other games for the residents at the Waltemade Nursing Care Center, or the Meadowview Assisted Living or the Adult Day Care on our campus. Also chess, domino, bridge etc players needed.
10552.title: Games Master

10552.description: Are you musically inclined, can paint, play an instrument, act or dance? We would like to have you share those talents with us and our residents at either the Waltemade Nursing Care Center, the Meadowview Assisted Living or our Adult Day Care.
10552.title: Share a Special Talent

10552.description: Pamper our residents in the Walemade Nursing Care Center, at the Meadowview Assisted Living or our Adult Day Care with hand massages and manicures.
10552.title: Beauty and the Senior

10552.description: Assist our residents at the Waltemade Nursing Care Center with crafts projects and helping pour and mold the creations in our kiln.
10552.title: Ceramic/crafts Assistant

07424.description: Welcome to the Inaugural Gray Mud Run! We thank you for supporting the National Brain Tumor Society’s efforts to find a cure for brain tumors and improve the quality of life and treatment options for those living with a Brain Tumor. This is the first event established in Northern New Jersey to serve the brain tumor community (and the first of it’s kind for NBTS)... And we are so excited to be here! The Gray Mud Run is a family friendly fun run and muddy obstacle course. The Adult course is a 5K and the Kids course is a 3K. This event was inspired by the life and brain tumor journey of Lindsay Gray. Beloved daughter, sister, friend and fearless NJ State Trooper. We are working together with the NJ State Troopers to reach the entire Tri-State area brain tumor community with this event and look forward to having a remarkable turn out! We need volunteers for many different jobs... From manning obstacles to running registration, and everything inbetween. So let's have a conversation so we can decide what would be the right fit for you! Looking forward to connecting! Suzanne
07424.title: Gray Mud Run

07424.description: We are looking for sporting enthusiasts (ie. Basketball, Baseball, Tennis, etc.) who are interested in sharing their passion with individuals who are striving to embark on having a more active and healthy lifestyle through our Active Life for a Healthy Mind program. We have regularly scheduled activities for individuals who self-identify with anxiety and/or depression. Volunteers would be expected to help in guiding individuals in these activities, while maintaining a fun and safe atmosphere during the activity. Candidates volunteering in this capacity should be proficient in the basic skills of the sport(s) in which they would volunteer to lead and be interested in teaching them to individuals with little or no experience with them. Active Life for a Healthy Mind activities will be held throughout the northern NJ/Tristate area.
07424.title: ALHM Activity Leaders - Sports

07424.description: We are looking for outdoor enthusiasts who are interested in sharing their passion of the outdoors with individuals who are striving to embark on having a more active and healthy lifestyle through our Active Life for a Healthy Mind program. We have regularly scheduled hikes for individuals who self-identify with anxiety and/or depression. Volunteers would be expected to help in guiding individuals on local hikes of varying difficulty levels and help in maintaining safety during the activity. Candidates volunteering in this capacity should be comfortable with being outdoors and knowledgeable about hiking in general. Active Life for a Healthy Mind activities will be held throughout the northern NJ/Tristate area.
07424.title: ALHM Activity Leaders - Outdoor

07420.description: We are a rural rescue in southern WV that works in collaboration with rescues in northeastern states to save the lives of dogs in our area. What we need your help with is Saturday afternoon/evening transport driving. If you can help us move a few dogs in your vehicle on an occasional Saturday (say once a month?) please submit this driver application: http://form.jotform.us/form/50214993744156
07420.title: Our dogs need YOU!
07420.org: A Reason To Believe Animal Rescue, Inc. (ARTBAR)

07421.description: Memories Live (www.memorieslive.org) is a 501c3 based in NJ that whose mission is to help individuals with terminal illnesses share their wisdom, stories and images with their loved ones. Memories Live is fielding an eight-person relay team in the Ragnar New Jersey trail race in West Milford, Oct 5 and Oct 6 where for 24 hours (or so) we will run a combined distance of 125 miles. We are running to try to raise $10,000 for Memories Live. As one of the non-profit partners, we are working to help enlist volunteers for various three hour shifts at the event in West Milford and assisting in this effort. Some of the tasks that volunteers take on include handing out medals, filling water jugs, monitoring trash and compost, and assisting in the transition tent. Please let me know if there might be interest and I’d be happy to connect with more details about the event and Memories Live. Thanks Neil Glass neil.glass@memorieslive.org 646-319-3105
07421.title: Memories Live-Ragnar Race 10/5 or 10/6

11507.description: If you’re looking to make a lasting impact on a deserving youth, consider becoming a Viscardi Mentor today! By creating a meaningful relationship, based on trust and open communication, mentors help young people gain a sense of belonging, build self-confidence and learn new skills and passions. To enroll or for more information, contact Michelle Licata at mlicata@viscardicenter.org or 516.465.1415. Benefits of Being a Mentor: * Gain a sense of fulfilment and personal growth * Develop leadership and management qualities * Improve communication and interpersonal relationship skills * Build a larger professional network * Be recognized for your talents and experience * Strengthen your own self-worth and confidence * Learn new things about yourself and others * Enhance your CV with community involvement * Better understand how people perceive you * Grow your circle of friends * Contribute to the overall well-being of your society The Viscardi Center’s new Mentoring Initiative program is designed for students, ages 11-17 with a disability or those considered \"at-risk\", and assists youth in realizing their potential and achieving their personal and educational goals.
11507.title: Wanted: College Students as Volunteer Mentors for Youth with Disabilities

11507.description: The Viscardi Center Mentoring Initiative (VCMI) is a new mentorship program for at-risk youth with disabilities. The goal of the initiative is to improve the outcomes for at-risk youth (between the ages of 11 and 17) with disabilities through high-quality one-on-one mentoring. The Viscardi Center is seeking adults aged 18+ years to be mentors for at-risk youth living with any kind of disability. Benefits of Being a Mentor: * Gain a sense of fulfilment and personal growth * Develop leadership and management qualities * Improve communication and interpersonal relationship skills * Build a larger professional network * Be recognized for your talents and experience * Strengthen your own self-worth and confidence * Learn new things about yourself and others * Enhance your CV with community involvement * Better understand how people perceive you * Grow your circle of friends * Contribute to the overall well-being of your society For more information, contact: Michelle Licata at mlicata@viscardicenter.org or 516.465.1415. \"Mentoring is a structured and trusting relationship that brings young people together with caring individuals who offer guidance, support and encouragement aimed at developing the competence and character of the mentee.\" - Elements of Effective Practice MENTOR/The National Mentoring Partnership
11507.title: Join The Viscardi Center Mentoring Initiative

07649.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07649.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Oradell

07018.description: As a Programming and Student Engagement Volunteer, your primary role would be to ensure that administrative tasks (data entry, outreach to parents, outreach to students, making flyers, etc.) are complete. On at least a weekly (high school students)/monthly (college students) basis, you would communicate with students to provide ongoing motivation, encouragement and connection to each other and the program. In addition, you would support and coordinate external activities such as volunteer opportunities, events and trips and more Programming and Student Engagement Volunteers should commit for at least 6 months and commit to up to 5 hours a week depending on projects and tasks.
07018.title: Programming and Student Engagement Volunteer - NY/NJ

10001.description: The Institute for Immigrant Concerns is looking for an office administrator/ program assistant with an interest in immigrant affairs and administrative skills. Duties will include: intake and registration of new students; assisting with document preparation and mailings; answering phone calls from students and teachers; monitoring expenses; and coordinating the volunteer program. We are flexible regarding schedule.
10001.title: Program Assistant

10001.description: Institute for Immigrant Concerns, a not-for-profit providing ESOL classes for adult immigrants and refugees, started in 1997, is looking for ESL instructors. Must have Bachelor's or MA Degree and at least 2 years of English teaching experience (whether domestic or abroad). Our students are all motivated and studious adults. We put great emphasis on survival English, employment and cross-cultural awareness. Applicants should be available twice a week, on Tuesdays and Thursdays for our morning classes ( 9am-12pm). We are currently looking for ESOL teachers for the 8-week Fall cycle ( September 25-November 13), and welcome anyone with the potential of teaching future cycles. Applicants must send us a copy of their resume and a brief cover letter.
10001.title: ESOL Teachers for Adult Immigrants

10001.description: About the Institute The Institute for Immigrant Concerns (http://http://instituteforimmigrantconcerns.com/) is committed to equipping immigrant communities city-wide with English skills, computer training, job readiness, and referalls for social services. The Institute empowers immigrant families and communities in their quest for social and economic independence. To reach immigrants the Institute operates across New York City and frequently collaborates with other community groups. Our staff is as diverse as our clients and draws on talented individuals to create a powerful, sustainable impact in America's newest immigrants. Job Description The Bilingual Administrative Assistant is essential to maintaining an efficient office environment in support of Institute programs, staff, and volunteers. This position will be responsible for general office administration, organizing office resources, coordination of program activities, and program management support. This is an ideal position for those seeking administrative experience at a busy Manhattan non-profit. This program welcomes retired professionals. Though this position is primarily administrative, it presents an opportunity to get an introduction to non-profit management. Requirements: Commitment to work 3 months minimum Bilingual oral and written skills, preferably Russian but other languages welcome Excellent written and oral communication Knowledge of foreign languages Proficiency in MS Office and Excel Ability to work independently and alongside a team of staff and volunteers with a passion for immigrant empowerment Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment This internship is unpaid, but college credit may be available.
10001.title: Russian Speaking Program Assistant

10001.description: The Institute for Immigrant Concerns is looking for an office administrator/ program assistant with an interest in immigrant affairs and Spanish-speaking skills. We are flexible regarding schedule.

10001.description: Thank you for answering our ad! To learn more about Maya's Hope, go to www.mayashope.org. We are having a silent auction at our black tie gala on Friday, October 26th. We are in need of a visual merchandiser to set up our silent auction on a tight schedule. If you have what it takes, please read on. Visual merchandisers are in charge of creating attractive visual displays. You use your creativity to enhance the aesthetic appeal of the silent auction display. The main objective of visual merchandising is to increase sales and buyer attention, capitalizing on the human tendency to \"browse.\" Visual Merchandiser Duties and Responsibilities * Comprehend each product’s specific features and create plans to boost its image * Maintain and present visual displays in a compelling manner to attract bidders * Produce design ideas for displays * Create and install special displays to promote specific products * Acquire display materials and props by creating and maintaining liaison with procurement managers and vendors and suppliers * Determine effective use of space and lighting * Ascertain that bidding sheets and other details are clearly visible on each item * Lead and motivate merchandising teams to complete displays in a time efficient manner * Dress mannequins * Maintain inventory of supplies and tools used in handling merchandising activities and ensure that all dismantled displays are appropriately stored Please send a resume and references. 10001.description: MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS INTERN We are seeking an excellent communicator, writer, and avid social media user as a Marketing and Communications intern to support public relations, marketing, blog and social media for Global Goods Partners. Social Media and Web Responsibilities: Create content to grow the organization’s footprint, including social media and blog posts Research current artisan partners and product, maintain sample inventory Expand and maintain GGP’s social networking and online presence to promote GGP products, fundraising efforts, and stories of women artisan partners around the world. Create compelling narratives about GGP’s partners and work around the world. Research and update country and partner information currently on the website. Craft descriptive and appealing product descriptions for the website. the website. Craft descriptive and appealing product descriptions for the website. PR and Events Responsibilities: Connect with influential media outlets and journalists to place stories about company news, relevant holidays, and collections Outreach to potential media partners with pitches, press releases and curated line sheets Actively pursue permanent links on like-minded sites, and assist with implementing social media strategy. Organize events designed to engage our target market. Develop and enact a strategy for digital communications with consumers and other key stakeholders to include artisan stories, product information, and resources. Personal Requirements: Excellent research, communication and writing skills Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Experience with social media, blogging and creating public relations campaigns Interest in and knowledge of fair trade and ethical business Able to commit to 2-3 days per week during the summer college break Specific Qualifications (a plus but not necessary): Experience in creating and implementing public relations campaigns, including familiarity with print and online media Proficiency with Photoshop, Shopify, SEO, Adwords Familiarity with e-mail marketing applications like vertical response Interest in fashion, design, or craft production Hours: 18-25 hours/week Location: 115 W 30th Street, Suite 400, New York How to Apply: Please send resume and cover letter via email to sharrison@globalgoodspartners.org No phone calls, please. Global Goods Partners is an equal opportunity employer _________________ Global Goods Partners is a non-profit, social enterprise based in NYC that is dedicated to alleviating poverty and promoting social justice by strengthening women-led development initiatives around the world. We partner with organizations, associations, and cooperatives worldwide that integrate their commitment to community development-specifically, improvements in education, health, women’s rights, and employment opportunities-with socially responsible income-generating enterprises. We create economic opportunity by offering design direction, generating demand, and bringing the unique, handmade, and quality fashion accessories that our more than 40 partners in 22 countries produce to the U.S. and international markets through our website, www.globalgoodspartners.org.
10001.title: Marketing & Communications Intern

10001.description: Thank you for your interest in Maya's Hope! Here's more about Maya's Hope: www.mayashope.org. Who should apply: Someone who has NYC event planning experience and has done events of 300 or more people. (Requirement: must have done NYC charity events and know the ins and outs of a silent auction!) When It’s flexible! We can work with your schedule, but you will need to be available all day and evening on Oct. 26th, the date of our Gala. And you will need to spend a day or part of a couple of days in our office soon for orientation. Venue: 583 Park Avenue About Maya’s Hope is a 501(c)3 organization that is dedicated to improving the lives of orphaned, special needs, and disenfranchised children on a global scale. We are looking for that special person who has experience recruiting, training and supervising volunteers for a New York City Gala. We have great volunteers; we just need you to organize their efforts to help make our annual Gala spectacular! This is our biggest fundraising event of the year and the cuties we help depend on its success. This is a part-time volunteer position that involves working both onsite and virtually. You should know how to use spreadsheets and google calendar in order to organize and schedule volunteer hours. If you have the Gala background, organizational and leadership skills, and enthusiasm we need for this important position, please send the following: 1) letter as to why you are perfect for this role 2) resume If you are a suitable candidate, we will contact you and please be prepared to provide three references who have worked with you at a charity gala. If you do not have experience with charity galas and silent auctions, you will not be considered. Thank you!
10001.title: Charity Gala Event Planner needed for October 27th (Pre-Planning involved)

10001.description: We are looking for amazing and exceptional individuals to join our host committee for the Maya's Hope Lotus Ball on Friday, October 26, 2018 at 583 Park Avenue! Maya's Hope improves the quality of life of disadvantaged, orphaned and extremely impoverished children around the world. This will be the 7th Annual Gala for Maya's Hope and you can help us reach our goal of $300,000! We are looking for individuals from a wide array of backgrounds: law, medicine, entrepreneurs, real estate, finance and those who want to make a difference! Here's what is required: -Purchase your ticket upon joining ($350.00) - Attend and actively participate in a majority of Committee Meetings In person participation is assumed although a conference call option will be available for those with special circumstances or last minute scheduling issues. - Commit to raising a minimum of $4,000 for the Gala through sponsorships, ticket sales, and auction items with the goal of securing at least one sponsor, one live auction item (Auction item needs include exotic vacation destinations, airfare, unique experiences such as celebrity chef-hosted house parties, rounds of golf with local celebrities, exclusive tickets to sporting or arts event, etc.) - Solicit sponsorships from at least five companies - Solicit in-kind donations such as graphic design and photography services, discounted printing, - Hand address and personalize invitations to at least 15 individuals from your personal network for the Gala. -Be Ambassadors of Maya's Hope -Have integrity and show respect to all volunteers, members of the committee, board and humankind :) If you meet these criteria, please send an email explaining why you would like to join and please attach a copy of your resume or LinkedIn page. Please email maya@mayashope.org. If selected, you will be part of an extraordinary event which directly impacts the lives of the children we serve. Here is a video from our 2017 gala: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zQyb8SHA02U&t=28s Here are photos from 2017 Gala: https://www.facebook.com/pg/MayasHope/photos/?tab=album&album_id=1748530808499062 We understand that not everyone has the time and resources to meet these expectations but still have a desire to help. To this end, there are other volunteer opportunities available for those individuals who are unable to commit to the full list of tasks outlined above.
10001.title: Join the Host Committee for Maya's Hope Lotus Ball 2018

10001.description: Are you looking for employee engagement or team building activities for your company, department or group? Hudson Guild is a multi-service community center serving those who live, work, or go to school in Chelsea, with a focus on those in need. With offerings as varied as community service projects for at-risk teens, mental health counseling for low-income individuals, wellness services for older adults, arts programming, and early childhood education for children, the Guild provides services to people in need and other activities to ensure a vibrant, safe, and healthy community. Please contact Rebecca Dealy at rdealy@hudsonguild.org or 212-760-9800 for more information!

10001.description: As an Outreach Coordinator with Restore Hope, you will be on the front lines of ministry, leading volunteer teams at outreach events, conducting and following up on care visits with women, and working with staff to build relationships with partner organizations. Responsibilities: Outreach Coordinators are responsible for overseeing Restore Hope’s monthly outreaches. You will coordinate transportation of outreach supplies to the location. During outreach, you will lead volunteer teams by sharing Restore Hope’s mission, providing brief outreach training for new volunteers, and assigning volunteers an area to serve. You will also meet with women for care visits, learning her story, creating an action plan to help her reach her goals, and writing referrals to organizations that can assist with the action plan. It is your responsibility to keep track of services provided at outreaches and enter this information, along with care visit notes, in our database. You will be responsible for conducting follow-up to your care visits, scheduling additional visits and providing referrals as needed. On occasion, you may be asked to visit with a potential or existing partner organization, helping to expand Restore Hope’s network of resources. You may also be asked to attend meetings to share your experiences and stories from outreach. Qualifications: An Outreach Coordinator should have at least 3-months experience volunteering or working in homeless ministry. You are an outgoing and engaging person who thrives in a team environment. You have strong leadership skills and enjoy finding creative solutions to conflicts and issues that arise. You have a relationship with God and are eager to share His love with the world. Please be prepared to provide a brief statement describing your approach to ministry and what you will bring to the Restore Hope team. We will also ask for one personal reference who can speak to your spiritual walk and leadership skills.
10001.title: Restore Hope Outreach Coordinator

10001.description: VOLUNTEERS NEEDED TO HELP WITH OUR BNW SUMMER 2018 PROGRAM FOR HOMELESS CHILDREN Join The Actors Theatre Workshop in helping change the lives of children living in temporary housing facilities! This summer, we are working with Nickelodeon to create a very special field trip and learning opportunity for the children who graduated our Builders of the New World Program in Spring 2017. We are looking for responsible adults passionate about bringing a change in the community to mentor the children and rehearse them for two classes leading up to their trip to Nickelodeon. You will be trained by ATW’s Artistic Director and Founder, Thurman E. Scott, and have the once in a lifetime opportunity to be a part of our award-winning theatre and education program for precious 8 - 12 year old New York City children: Complete this application and attend an Information Session to learn more about volunteering at this community program and be interviewed on Saturday, June 30th, Saturday, July 7th and Saturday, July 14th from 3:00 - 5:00pm Attend a Training Session with ATW’s Artistic Director and Founder on Tuesday, July 17th from 6:00 - 9:30 PM Join the children on Wednesday, July 25th and Monday, July 30th from 12:00 - 5:00 PM! To apply visit: https://www.actorstheatreworkshop.com/bnw-spring-2018/ For more information, contact us at outreach@actorstheatreworkshop.com, or call ATW at 212-947-1386.
10001.title: VOLUNTEERS NEEDED TO HELP WITH OUR BNW SUMMER 2018 PROGRAM FOR HOMELESS CHILDREN

10001.description: Lantern Community Services champions the independence and well-being of New Yorkers who are formerly homeless or have recently aged out of foster care recreate their lives. Our programs with proven results in health, employment, education and life skills are delivered inside our residences and tailored to each person’s needs. Lantern is looking for volunteers who can give 1-5 hours per week supporting our on-the-ground program staff! Each of these opportunities will lift the burden for your host site by relieving the staff of administrative work. This is a great opportunity to give back to a vulnerable community! This opportunity is available immediately at six of our locations (4 locations in the Bronx, 1 in Manhattan and 1 in Brooklyn). Details for each position are as follows: West Bronx location:Filing, scanning, organizing/archiving charts and other administrative assistance, including organizing supply closet. 1-5 hours per week. Longwood, Bronx location: Bilingual Spanish, requested. Filing, making copies, passing out flyers, organizing bulletin boards, organizing closets, organizing library books, supporting in setting up groups with facilitators and supporting facilitators, taking messages /providing messages. Up to 11am-5pm Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays; please apply for up to as much time as you can manage! Tremont, Bronx location:Filing, shredding, organizing/archiving charts and other administrative assistance, including organizing closet in Program Office. 1-5 hours per week. Tremont, Bronx location:Filing, shredding, organizing/archiving charts and other administrative assistance, including organizing closet in Program Office. 1-5 hours per week. Washington Heights location:Filing and other administrative assistance, including helping Resident Coordinator organize chart room. 1-5 hours per week. Brownsville, Brooklyn location: Filing and other administrative assistance. Fridays would be preferable, 1-5 hours per week. All of Lantern’s locations are accessible by public transportation. Great Lantern volunteers are non-judgmental, reliable, and really care about the problem of homelessness in New York City. If that sounds like you, we'd love to meet you! If you are interested, please contact Volunteer@lanterncommunity.org with your availability.
10001.title: Help With Administrative Work at Lantern!

10001.description: Do you have life coaching skills? Would you like to use those skills to help improve the lives of needy children? Then you may be just who we are looking for to help guide our Maya’s Hope Host Committee as they plan our Annual Gala! Every year, Maya’s Hope throws its Annual Gala to celebrate the Cutie Pies of Maya’s Hope and to raise funds to support them. We are looking for an amazing and exceptional individual to serve as a \"coach\" for our Host Committee in order to maximize its effectiveness as it prepares for Maya’s Hope Lotus Ball on Friday, October 26, 2018 at 583 Park Avenue. This will be the 7th Annual Maya’s Hope Gala. You can help us reach this year’s fundraising goal of $300,000! Founded in November 2010, Maya’s Hope has impacted the lives of hundreds of children in Ukraine and Philippines. You can learn more about our activities at: www.mayashope.org or www.facebook.com/mayashope This is a newly created volunteer position, so there is a lot of opportunity for you to structure and develop it based on your own expertise! We are looking for results-the better our host committee functions, the more money we raise for our Cutie Pies! Here’s what we think you will do:  teach skills, tactics, and techniques for successful teamwork  monitor and enhance performance by providing encouragement and constructive feedback after identifying strengths and weaknesses  develop a host committee training program Why should you want to work with our Host Committee?  Networking with accomplished, interesting committee members-people like you!  Attending exclusive events-not only the Gala, but concerts, mixers, karaoke, and more!  Making friend-our host committee members are great people, after all!  Having fun-our Gala and other fundraising events are a blast!  Helping our Cutie Pies-and isn’t that what it is all about? If you think you are the right person for this position, please email maya@mayashope.org. If selected, you will be part of an extraordinary event which directly impacts the lives of the children we serve. We understand that not everyone has the time and resources to meet these expectations but may still have a desire to help. To this end, there are other volunteer opportunities available for you if you are unable to commit to the full list of tasks outlined above. Thank you for your willingness to make a huge difference in the lives of the children we support at Maya’s Hope!
10001.title: Life Coach needed for Group/Individuals to help fundraise!

10001.description: Hudson Guild Adult Services program is actively seeking Friendly Visitors to assist older adults in the Chelsea community: Friendly Visitors assist seniors who have limited mobility by visiting them in their home. Your help is vital for their health and safety! Please contact Rebecca Dealy at rdealy@hudsonguild.org or 212-760-9800 for more information! Hudson Guild is a multi-service community center serving those who live, work, or go to school in Chelsea, with a focus on those in need. With offerings as varied as community service projects for at-risk teens, mental health counseling for low-income individuals, wellness services for older adults, arts programming, and early childhood education for children, the Guild provides services to people in need and other activities to ensure a vibrant, safe, and healthy community. The Guild's Adult Services Program has helped older adults live in independence and dignity as contributing members of the community since 1947. The Guild offers a range of programs designed to respond to emerging trends and needs in the senior population, with a focus on keeping adults healthy, active and engaged through a range of educational recreational and health promotion services and activities.
10001.title: Help Older Adults

10001.description: Do you speak English and Russian? Are you looking for ways to use your language skills to make a difference in your community and country? Are you interested in enhancing your language skills through professional linguistic resources at no cost to you? If yes, then the National Language Service Corps (NLSC) may be the right place for you. The NLSC is a Federal government organization consisting of on-call, multilingual volunteers who are willing to use their language skills and cultural knowledge to help government agencies in their readiness efforts, and communities in times of need. In order to volunteer, you must first join the organization as a Member; there is no membership fee required. Though Members are volunteers to the Corps, if their language skills are needed and they choose to participate, they are compensated by means of a small stipend and per diem in some instances.
10001.title: RUSSIAN INTERPRETERS, US CITIZENS
