We provide free of charge after-school, project-based, hands-on, team structures programs in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math to underserved students in New Jersey. Classes include: Robotics, Coding, Engineering, Life Sciences, etc. and are focused on kids grade 5-8. The programs last 10 weeks and are taught predominantly by volunteer college students that we recruit, train, transport and mentor as they donate 2 hours/week to the program. Soldering 101. Help kids grade 4-8 learn to Solder and complete various prokects. The JerseySTEM MakerClub is looking for adults to mentor young engineers (age 8-14) to learn how to tinker, solder, make. - Basic of soldering - Sundays 9am-11am or 10am-12pm
07901.title: COA:Soldering Sunday in Summit, NJ

07901.description: FIRST team needs a coach to help teach Android Studio/ Java environment on Saturdays 1pm-4pm. Curriculum available.
07901.title: COA: Android Studio/Java coach for FIRST Robotics team

07901.description: Would you like to help cover our front desk - greeting visitors and answering the phone in our friendly environment? You can come on a regular basis (filling in at lunchtime) or as a substitute. We're looking for a few people with good communication skills to join our great group of volunteers. Training will be provided.
07901.title: Front Desk Receptionist

07901.description: Social Media expert to help us improve our web presence and initiate crowd funding.
07901.title: Social Media expert

07901.description: We are looking for mentors to coach motivated urban high school students from Newark and Jersey City. Mentored youth have significantly better chances for high school graduation and college acceptance, thereby significantly increasing life's opportunities. You can make a huge difference in someone's life!!
07901.title: Do you want to help an urban student - Be a Mentor - Make a life-long difference!

07901.description: Would you like to do your share to ensure that area older adults get a hot meal each weekday? Help us set up our kitchen at SAGE Eldercare. Duties include getting the kitchen prepared for volunteers to deliver meals. No cooking. Pack milk and individual cold meal bags. Set up route delivery bags. Organize small food pantry. Fairly heavy lifting is required. Pick one, two or three days. Hours: Monday through Friday 8am to 10am
07901.title: Meals on Wheels Kitchen Help - Mornings

07901.description: Work on a team of 2-4 volunteers to respond to 9-1-1 emergency medical calls. Learn to operate an ambulance as well as the equipment carried in it. Provide community education in health and safety topics. All training and uniforms are provided.
07901.title: Emergency Medical Technician

07648.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07648.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Norwood

07648.description: Life Choice Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers to visit our hospice patients throughout Northern NJ. Providing our patients with loving touch and care from certified pet therapy animals and owners is beyond appreciated by both our patients and our staff. Your dog must be certified and the handler needs training by Life Choice Hospice as a hospice volunteer. Volunteer training and medical requirements are provided FREE by Life Choice. Please help bring companionship and joy into the life of a Hospice patient!
07648.title: Share Your Pet’s Love – Seeking Certified Pet Therapy Volunteers for Hospice!

07648.description: Description Use what you have learned in the classroom to help improve the quality of life for hospice patients. Utilize free time to be compassionate and genuine in order to reduce terminally ill patients’ loneliness and isolation. Please help us keep our patients happy and comfortable as they reach the end of their life due to a variety of health conditions including: cancer, Alzheimer’s, etc. How can you benefit by being a volunteer? Build your resume: Volunteer experience shows proof of motivation, commitment, initiative, dependability, and flexibility Develop interpersonal skills Increase meaning and purpose in your life Experience significant opportunities for growth and development Responsibilities of Companion volunteers: Contribute to our patients' quality of life Attend to Patients' Needs Communicate with Nurses by keeping them Up to Date about each Patient visited Maintain Patients' Confidentiality Travel and Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to them, give hand massage, assist in life review or memory building We offer you: FREE TB test and MMR Titer Extremely flexible assignments (anytime you can give is greatly appreciated) Convenient Orientation and FREE training and that fits your schedule Receive Internship Credit (if applicable-unpaid)
07648.title: Great Opportunity for Healthcare Students!

06840.description: On Friday, October 12th and Saturday, October 13th, the New Canaan Nature Center will be holding its annual Fall Fair, a day of old-fashioned family fun! This event includes amusement rides, carnival games & prizes, pony rides, pumpkin decorating, food, and so much more! Volunteers are needed solely on Saturday, the 13th, and will help with Fair games, activities, and ticket collection. Stay for the entire day or volunteer for one of the following shifts: Shift 1 (9:30am-12:30pm) Shift 2 (12:30-3:30pm) Shift 3 (3:30-6:30pm)
06840.title: Fall Fair

06840.description: Welcome visitors as they arrive and answer phone calls during the staff lunchbreak (12-1pm) This opportunity would suit a warm and friendly individual with good communication skills. Training and supervision will be given. We also welcome those who are seeking to build up their office/phone skills or gain experience in a medical environment. Providing regular or occasional cover on the Front Desk is a great way to support this non-profit and help contribute to continuing the tradition of excellence and strong partnerships with surrounding communities.
06840.title: Reception/Front Desk

06840.description: Are you thinking of trying volunteering? We will provide you with the opportunity to explore your interests and use your experience and skills while you make a difference in the community. Perhaps you have been busy with work or family commitments for years and now find you have some time available or perhaps you have never tried volunteering before? Either way we will welcome you, train and mentor you and provide activities and a schedule that will work for you as you support our mission of helping residents \"Lead Fuller Lives\". Along the way you we hope you find that you are also leading a fuller life as a result of the time spent volunteering at Waveny LifeCare!
06840.title: First Time Volunteer!

06840.description: We have openings for regular volunteers to help serve Lunch 12-1pm and/or Dinner 6-7pm any day of the week. Part of the role is to serve lunch under direction of Waveny Staff and part of the role is to develop a social relationship with our long term residents who enjoy the chance to make new friends.
06840.title: Serving Lunch/Dinner

06840.description: Share your love and experience with dance and movement with the teens in our adolescent transitional living program. We have carved out Sunday and Monday at 4:00 p.m. as the ideal days/times on our patient program schedule. Ideally you have taken some creative movement and dance classes in your community or at school and have some experience leading groups. Volunteers are required to attend a hospital orientation (the first Monday of the month except when this Monday falls on a holiday then the training is on the second Monday of the month) and also submit to a criminal background check. Please tell us more about your personal and professional background and send a resume to lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or call 203-801-2320 for additional information.
06840.title: Movement/Dance Group for Adolescent Program

06840.description: Volunteers and their dogs who have been certified by a pet therapy program (e.g., Good Dog Foundation, Pet Partners, Therapy Dogs International) visit with their dogs on Wednesday and/or Saturday mornings in one or two of our patient programs. All visits are approximately 30 minutes in length and are in a group setting. New volunteers will receive an orientation from the director of volunteer services and supervision by our staff during each pet therapy visit. We love pet therapy at Silver Hill! We hope to hear from you soon and have you join our existing pet therapy team. If you have a loveable dog and would like to learn more about how to become a certified pet therapy team, contact the pet therapy certification programs listed above to learn more. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero 203-801-2320 or lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org for additional information about the pet therapy program and pet therapy visit schedule at Silver Hill Hospital.
06840.title: Seeking certified pet therapy teams!

06840.description: We are seeking mature college students, recent college graduates or graduate students who are interested in the mental health field and who would like to volunteer to support our teen patients (ages 13-17) during their school time period on weekday mornings (Monday-Friday 9:15-11:15 a.m.). Volunteers choose the days they are available and work with the teacher to support teen patients while they complete homework assignments or engage in other structured activities (puzzles, arts/crafts, board games). Volunteers provide supportive, positive dialogues that motivate and support our youngest patients who are in treatment for a psychiatric or addictive disorder. After being selected for this position, volunteers must complete a one-day hospital orientation that takes place on the first Monday of the month (except on holiday Mondays). Candidates must also provide one written reference and provide documentation of a negative PPD (TB screening). We look forward to hearing from you. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320.
06840.title: School Time Assistant-Adolescent Program

06840.description: Please volunteer at Silver Hill to share your love of baking and some simple recipes that allow a group of patients enjoy Friday or Sunday morning with you, each other and the staff. Our baking group volunteers arrive at 10:45 a.m. to set everything up in the kitchen of a residential program. You will teach the residents how to follow a recipe, organize the ingredients, and end up with a tasty (and sometimes healthy) treat for all to enjoy. You select the recipe and we will buy the ingredients or you may do so and we will reimburse you. You do not have to be a professional pastry chef; however you should be mature and comfortable with yourself and others. Ideally, we would like you to participate in one of our hospital orientations that take place on the first Monday of the month (except holiday Mondays). A background check (hospital conducts) and a current reference (you provide) are required.
06840.title: Calling all Sunday morning bakers!

06840.description: Show patients in our new residential eating disorders program located on the second floor of our Main House how to knit and to also appreciate the value of knitting. Choose Monday, Tuesday OR Friday from 6:30-7:30 pm to offer your talents and supportive conversation. Your ongoing (weekly) presence offers you and the patients an opportunity to develop a rapport and to pick up any threads of conversations from the previous weeks. It's all in good fun and gives patients a creative outlet for eating disorder recovery. To ensure that you will have what you need each time you volunteer, you will select easy to use (simple) knitting supplies and yarn and the hospital will reimburse you for your purchases. Hospital orientation and criminal background check are required and ongoing volunteer supervision is provided.
06840.title: Knit One, Purl Two: Teach Knitting to Patients

06840.description: We seek mature, personable, and discreet individuals to greet and direct visitors to the inpatient adolescent unit during regularly scheduled family programs and visiting hours on the weekends (12:45-2:30PM Saturday and Sunday). This volunteer position will afford you with an opportunity to interact with patients, family members and staff and gain exposure to the operations of a psychiatric hospital and various staff roles and functions. You will also learn about the types of services offered to individuals with psychiatric or addiction disorders. Volunteers may select available weekend dates that work with their availability.
06840.title: Adolescent Unit-Greet Visitors on Weekends

06840.description: Patients at Silver Hill Hospital who are struggling with addiction or psychiatric illness engage in many therapeutic activities, including volunteer-led groups that also allow volunteers to share a hobby, pasttime or talent. We are seeking volunteers to share their love of music and their musical talents (e.g., voice, guitar, keyboard) once or twice per month on an ongoing basis on Tuesday or Wednesday before lunchtime. You don't have to be a virtuoso, concert master or a stage performer, but you should be comfortable working in a group setting and have a relaxed, warm manner. We will provide you with an orientation and staff support. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at 203-801-2320 or volunteer@silverhillhospital.org
06840.title: Do you play an instrument or sing?

06840.description: Using any format that you practice, lead a 30-45 minute group of adult patients in a seated movement and/or meditation session that helps patients achieve a more relaxed state and acquire new skills. You must possess outstanding communication skills, practice meditation in your personal life and be comfortable leading an educational group. All volunteer-led groups are monitored by our professional staff. Hospital orientation and training session required. Must provide one reference and authorize a criminal background check. All volunteers must also have a recent TB screening test (PPD) prior to starting as a volunteer.
06840.title: Meditation/Seated Movement Group Leader

06840.description: We seek mature, personable, and discreet individuals to greet and direct visitors for our Main House facility during regularly scheduled family visiting hours and patient dining hours on the weekends (12:30-2:30PM Saturday and Sunday). This volunteer position will afford you with an opportunity to interact with patients, family members and staff and gain exposure to the operations of a psychiatric hospital and various staff roles and functions. You will also learn about the types of services offered to individuals with psychiatric or addiction disorders. Volunteers may select available dates that work with their availability.
06840.title: Greet Patients & Families During Weekend Visiting Hours

06840.description: Have you made a difference in your community? Here's a great idea, change a life - with just one hour per week you can help a blind person continue toward their goal of independent living. Read their mail, drive them to the grocery store or bank, help them label household items. It's easy and you can set your own schedule! This is a great way to spring into action and dust off to achieve that olde New Year's Resolution to make your world a better place!
06840.title: Spring into Action:  Can You Change a Life in One Hour a Week?
06840.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06840.description: Patients in our Women's Transitional Living Program (28-day program) attend volunteer-led 12-step discussion groups and workshops as part of their therapeutic program and personal recovery journey. Volunteers who lead these groups are also women in recovery. You play an integral role in our patients' recovery process by sharing your personal stories of strength, hope and recovery and how you maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Volunteers use AA literature like \"Living Sober\" and \"The Big Book \"and discuss a variety of themes/topics, i.e., Slogans, Acceptance, Living Sober, Relapse Prevention with small groups of women at our Barrett House residence
06840.title: Women's Group 12-step Meeting Leader (Peer Support Group)

06840.description: Adolescent patients in treatment for substance abuse disorders participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs and also attend 12-step based discussion groups as part of their recovery journey. Volunteers, who are also in recovery, active in a 12-step program and working with a Sponsor, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of messages of hope, as well as how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Daytime and evening volunteer opportunities are available in our adolescent inpatient and transitional living program (residential, 28-day program).
06840.title: Help Teens Overcome Addiction (12-step group)

06840.description: Are you super organized and like helping others at the same time? Please join our group of volunteers who are task masters of the universe! Our patient billing department is seeking a mature, personable volunteer or two to assist with basic office duties while adhering to HIPAA policies (e.g., scanning, filing, chart making) on Monday and/or Friday 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. An added plus is that you will be working in our new state-of-the-art building. Volunteers are requested to attend a general hospital orientation that is offered on the first Monday of the month (2nd Monday if the latter falls during a holiday) and to also give us authorization to conduct a criminal background check. Volunteers will be trained and supervised by the department staff. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320.
06840.title: Office Assistant-Silver Hill Hospital

06840.description: Silver Hill Hospital's \"Little Shop\" was one of the first places in the organization that volunteers contributed their time and talents. The Little Shop, open weekdays from 3:30-5:30 pm, continues to be a charming place for patients, families, volunteers and staff to purchase personal convenience items, books, themed jewelry and much more. Volunteers will train and volunteer with our Wellness Program Coordinator and volunteer on any weekday that works best for you. Retail experience or other customer service experience is a plus. We prefer volunteers who live within a 20 minute drive from the hospital. Volunteer candidates must sign an authorization for a criminal background check.
06840.title: Book/Gift Shop Attendant

06840.description: Patients living with psychiatric disorders participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs designed to augment their medication protocols and provide them with new ways to understand their mental illness, along with better ways to relate and cope. Volunteers, who are living happier lives while in recovery from a psychiatric illness, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and healing, and how they maintain a balanced life while living with a mental illness.
06840.title: Psychiatric Peer Support Group Leader

06840.description: Patients at Silver Hill participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs and also attend 12-step practicum meetings as part of their recovery journey. Volunteers, who are personally active in a 12-step program and are working with a sponsor, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and recovery and how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Daytime and evening volunteer opportunities are available for both adult and adolescent inpatient and transitional living program (residential).
06840.title: 12-Step Discussion Group Leader

06840.description: Work directly with our patients and recreational therapy staff to provide recreational activities that enrich and enhance our patients' existing treatment programs in our adult psychiatric unit on weekdays at 2:00 p.m.
06840.title: Recreational Group Assistant

07869.description: Grace Healthcare Services welcomes is looking for Hospice volunteers. We welcome your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give unconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com!
07869.title: Become a Hospice Volunteer!

07869.description: Want to learn new skills, serve your community and help build a house all at the same time? Volunteer at the Morris Habitat ReStore! The Morris Habitat ReStore is a successful retail outlet that provides new and gently-used building materials and home furnishings. Volunteers are vital in keeping the ReStore operating! All proceeds from the ReStore help build decent affordable housing. Volunteer areas are: Administrative Support: General knowledge of computers to help set-up and/or maintain record-keeping files, tracking volunteer hours, answer phones. Good computer skills, including experience with Word and Excel. Warehouse Support: Help with pricing and appraising, floor assistance or furniture repairs ReStore Truck Helper: Assist on our box truck to pick up donations to bring back to the ReStore. Cashier: Ring up customers Customer Service Support: Assist customers shopping with current sales and answer general questions ReStore Collections Team: Research items to determine value, monitoring and updating our store, speaking to potential donors, helping to ship and photograph items. We are also looking for individual subject area experts such as Art, Coins and valuables. Contact Stephanie Sayki for more information Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: ReStore Warehouse Support

07869.description: About our Building Program Our sites are opened to volunteers Monday-Saturday from 8:30am-4pm. All are welcome, no special skills are needed! All we ask for is a smile and a willingness to help. Construction volunteers do everything from pouring footings to roofing and final interior finishes. General Information : 1. We build most Mondays through Saturdays at sites in and around Morris County. Current Active Sites: Dover, Budd Lake, and West Milford. More site starting this Spring. 2. Our construction day is 8:30 AM to 4:00 PM. Unless otherwise advised, volunteers should bring a bag lunch. Lunch is 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM. 3.Construction volunteers must be 16 years of age to be present on an active build site. Youth volunteers ages 16 or 17 years old must be accompanied by an adult chaperone. Chaperones must be 21 years of age. One adult chaperone is required for every 5 youth. What to Expect: 1. A Site Supervisor is in charge of the work and volunteers each work day. 2. All are welcomed-No special skills are needed! 3. All we ask for is a smile and a willingness to help. We will send you home tired, dirty and happy! Contact Stephanie Sayki on how to sign up for a day: Stephanie Sayki-stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: General Construction-New Builds and Home Repair

07869.description: Want to learn new skills, serve your community and help build a house all at the same time? Volunteer at the Morris Habitat ReStore! The Morris Habitat ReStore is a successful retail outlet that provides new and gently-used building materials and home furnishings. Volunteers are vital in keeping the ReStore operating! All proceeds from the ReStore help build decent affordable housing. Volunteer areas are: Administrative Support: General knowledge of computers to help set-up and/or maintain record-keeping files, tracking volunteer hours, answer phones. Good computer skills, including experience with Word and Excel. Warehouse Support: Help with pricing and appraising, floor assistance or furniture repairs ReStore Truck Helper: Assist on our box truck to pick up donations to bring back to the ReStore. Cashier: Ring up customers Customer Service Support: Assist customers shopping with current sales and answer general questions ReStore Collections Team: Research items to determine value, monitoring and updating our store, speaking to potential donors, helping to ship and photograph items. We are also looking for individual subject area experts such as Art, Coins and valuables. Contact Stephanie Sayki for more information Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: ReStore Donations Truck Helper

07869.description: Special Events Committee Events Committee: Planning and coordination Support Committee: Setup, cleanup, work day of event Contact Stephanie Sayki Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: Special Events Committee

07869.description: Want to learn new skills, serve your community and help build a house all at the same time? Volunteer at the Morris Habitat ReStore! The Morris Habitat ReStore is a successful retail outlet that provides new and gently-used building materials and home furnishings. Volunteers are vital in keeping the ReStore operating! All proceeds from the ReStore help build decent affordable housing. Contact Stephanie Sayki for more information Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: ReStore -Concierge and Greeter

07869.description: Want to learn new skills, serve your community and help build a house all at the same time? Volunteer at the Morris Habitat ReStore! The Morris Habitat ReStore is a successful retail outlet that provides new and gently-used building materials and home furnishings. Volunteers are vital in keeping the ReStore operating! All proceeds from the ReStore help build decent affordable housing. Volunteer areas are: Administrative Support: General knowledge of computers to help set-up and/or maintain record-keeping files, tracking volunteer hours, answer phones. Good computer skills, including experience with Word and Excel. Warehouse Support: Help with pricing and appraising, floor assistance or furniture repairs ReStore Truck Helper: Assist on our box truck to pick up donations to bring back to the ReStore. Cashier: Ring up customers Customer Service Support: Assist customers shopping with current sales and answer general questions ReStore Collections Team: Research items to determine value, monitoring and updating our store, speaking to potential donors, helping to ship and photograph items. We are also looking for individual subject area experts such as Art, Coins and valuables. Contact Stephanie Sayki for more information Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: ReStore - Cashier

07080.description: Contact us for more information on working with hospice patients close to where you live. We provide FREE volunteer training for you along with free TB and Rubella/Rubeola testing. Your pet will need to be a certified pet therapy animal. You and your pet will bring joy and love to the lives of our patients and will receive so much love and joy in return!
07080.title: Share your pet's unconditional love with hospice patients!

07081.description: Do you have a passion for and experience in marketing and social media? Are you looking for an opportunity to grow your portfolio and social media experience? Making Strides of Jersey City is in search of a Social Media Volunteer to manage all of the Jersey City Strides social pages! Experience in marketing and/or social media and familiarity with social media platforms is preferred. Interested? Please send resumes to JerseyCityNJStrides@cancer.org no later than Friday, June 1st
07081.title: Social Media-Making Strides Against Breast Cancer of Jersey City

07081.description: This volunteer role entails working with the local staff to schedule and then execute opportunities to do outreach in the community with the ultimate goal of recruiting teams and survivors for our events. We would also like people who are comfortable tabling at health fairs and speaking to groups. Ideally, these volunteers will help us reach new populations which they belong to. If there are opportunities to help within the office, the local staff partner will inform volunteers and request help. Please note many of the health fairs and speaking engagements take place within Essex County, New Jersey.
07081.title: Outreach & Special Projects - Making Strides Against Breast Cancer of Newark

07081.description: Trinitas Children's Therapy Services is looking for responsible individuals to volunteer at its Springfield-based outpatient pediatric therapy center. Volunteers would be responsible for assisting therapists during recreation and therapeutic programs, organizing and cleaning materials and equipment and possibly performing a few light office duties (chart organization, filing, etc.). This is an excellent opportunity for high school or college students interested in allied health professions to gain valuable experience and obtain required observational hours or for any individuals who want to help kids succeed in life. Trinitas Children's Therapy Services is an affiliate of Trinitas Regional Medical Center and a leading provider of school and center based occupational, physical and speech therapy services for children of all ages. Our Springfield office hours are 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM Monday through Friday. Recreation programs (when volunteers are most needed) tend to run after school and in the early evenings.
07081.title: Children's Therapy Service

07081.description: Bring a smile to a senior. Volunteers are needed to participate in a periodic Friendly Visitation program for older adults in Essex County. Training and ongoing supervision and support are provided for all volunteers. In just a few hours per month, you can make a REAL difference in the life of a needy person.
07081.title: Project Cares Friendly Visitors Program

07083.description: Take the kettle challenge! We need your help! The Red Kettle has been part of The Salvation Army's tradition since 1891. Today, kettles are part of The Salvation Army's efforts to raise funds so critical to our on-going operations. Unfortunately for some, the holiday season can mean unmanageable expenses, disappointed children, and empty stomachs. Bellringers can work alone or in pairs, encouraging pedestrian's to contribute with ringing and friendly demeanors. Our kettle stands are \"manned\" Monday thru Saturday from early November until December 24th. The Salvation Army will have already secured prior permission for you to stand at a designated location and all of the equipment will be provided. Only a four-hour time commitment is required and flexible hours make bell-ringing ideal for volunteers with tight schedules and families who want to share the kettle experience and help the needy. This opportunity is perfect for groups seeking a group project that will make a difference not just at this time of giving but throughout the year. Consider organizing a group from your corporation, school, service club, college, church etc that will commit to staffing a kettle for a day or more, simply rotate your members throughout the day in shifts. There will be many kettle locations throughout New Jersey, one of which I am sure will be convenient for you.
07083.title: Salvation Army bell ringer
07083.org: The Salvation Army - New Jersey Division

07083.description: High school, and Middle school students in the New Jersey area can assist The Salvation Army and gain community service hours by volunteering their time to help collect and raise awareness in their community for The Salvation Army. Students can volunteer their time and receive 15 hours of community service credit by doing the following: 1) Host a Canned Food or Toiletries drive 2) Contact Njvolunteers@use.salvationarmy.org for flyers 3) Fill out flyers with a start and end date of your collection drive 4) Post throughout your school & community 5) Use social media (Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram) to promote to all your friends!
07083.title: Teen school project
07083.org: The Salvation Army - New Jersey Division

07083.description: JerseySTEM recruits College students to coach/teach STEM classes to underserved kids in New Jersey. For that, we mobilize: - Volunteer College Students to teach, - Libraries and Middle Schools to host - Corportations to sponsor The University Liaison serves as a conduit between JerseySTEM and the different institutions affiliated with the university. Duties: - Coordinate and/or Attend career fairs (twice a ear) - Connect with Deans and faculty to explore opportunities - Connect with students groups, collegiate chapters of professional societies to explore parterships Estimated time: - 2-4 hours/week. Mostly email. Please submit a resume and.or a linkedin profile.
07083.title: UNI: University Liaison @ Kean University

07083.description: MusicLink is in need of experienced music teachers in New Jersey. With MusicLink, students (children under 18 years old) who show an interest in taking music lessons, but cannot afford full fee lessons, are linked with qualified music teachers willing to reduce their fee by at least half to make the lessons more affordable. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation. MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check. Please see our website for more information: www.musiclinkfoundation.org .
07083.title: Music Teachers for Underprivileged Children

07083.description: School Program Volunteers All school tours take place Monday - Friday between 9:30 am - 1:30 pm - availability must be during those hours. All educators are dressed in period clothing - including volunteers. All period clothing will be provided. Must be comfortable around students ranging from 1st grade through high school - depending on the program. You’ll receive background information and training sessions before you start to teach a station on your own. We also will have you follow groups so you can experience the stations first hand and see how the topic gets taught.
07083.title: School Program Tour guide

07083.description: Emergency Disaster Services (or EDS) volunteers join The Salvation Army in providing physical, emotional, and spiritual comfort and support wherever and whenever disaster strikes. As an EDS volunteer, you may help serve food from canteens, speak with grieving victims, or perform other duties to assist in disaster recovery and clean-up efforts. EDS volunteers are the kind faces and helping hands that support police, firefighters and other first responders while assisting families and communities to recover from floods, fires, and other tragedies. EDS volunteers provide invaluable services to people during times of critical need. As an EDS volunteer, your assistance will only be needed during times of emergency. Volunteers must have their own transportation.
07083.title: Emergency Disaster Services (EDS) Volunteer
07083.org: The Salvation Army - New Jersey Division

07086.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with Bike MS: New York City’s Rest Stop location in Weehawken! Bike MS New York City will be held on Sunday, October 21 - Rest Stop volunteers are needed from 7:00am-9:00am in Weehawken, NJ. We welcome groups and individuals of all ages and abilities to join us as volunteers! Bike MS: New York City is a unique experience - the 30 mile route around Manhattan is completely traffic free. The 50 and 100 mile rides allow cyclists to ride through the Holland Tunnel traffic free. More than 300 volunteers are needed to make this event a success! If you are interested in volunteering, please review the position below and register online here: https://www.signupgenius.com/go/20f0944acab22abfd0-201813 Rest Stop Support Team: Date: Sunday, October 21, 2018 Time: 6:30am-9:00am Location: Weehawken, NJ Description: Volunteers will be assigned to the Weehawken rest stop which is along the Bike MS: New York City route. Volunteers will distribute water, snacks and cheer on walkers! If you have any questions, please contact: NYC Volunteer Engagement Team at NYCSNY.Volunteers@nmss.org or 212-453-3258
07086.title: Rest Stop Volunteers Needed in Weehawken for Bike MS: NYC!
07086.org: National MS Society - New York City

07086.description: Protect our environment and the special world in which we live. Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Together we can protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. Want to know more? Please join our weekly Introductory Conference Call. The next one is on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. It is a live call, about an hour long, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. Please register for the call at this link so that we can follow up with you: https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/ We look forward to working with you!
07086.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Weehawken NJ

07087.description: Use your skills to help the immigrant community and experience the joy of helping someone change their life. We are looking for committed volunteers to teach Spanish speaking students. Volunteers teach one, three-hour class a week for ten weeks. All classes are on Sundays. Previous teaching experience is not necessary, but commitment, ability and a desire to teach are key. Our teachers have included those with experience, those undergoing teacher training and those who have no experience at all. Some classes require Spanish speakers, but some do not. Comite En Union para Salvadorenos (CEUS) is a 501 (c)3 non-profit organization based in Union City, NJ that was founded by Central American refugees to help immigrants create a better life for themselves. The classes are now offered at Centro Comunitario CEUS, our community center 15 minutes from Manhattan. Our website is www.ceusnj.org. CEUS has organized ESL classes for 23 years.
07087.title: Teach English to immigrants - change your world and theirs!

11726.description: From time to time we need volunteers to assist with mailings - folding letters, stuffing envelopes and labeling envelopes.
11726.title: Office Work

11726.description: Volunteer to be on a committee such as our annual Chefs for A Cause fundraiser being held at the Venetian Yacht Club, our annual Golf Outing our perhaps our Bowling event. Several opportunities available. Duties can be varied: PR, decorating, raffle/giveaways,program, liason with restaurants/distributors. Also looking for someone who can type, and a photographer is always needed.
11726.title: Fund raising committee

10075.description: The Carter Burden Network is dedicated to supporting the efforts of older people to remain in their homes living independently, safely, and with dignity. Volunteers are an integral component of the Carter Burden Network's 40+ years of success. No matter your age, experience or schedule, CBN can accommodate your needs to ensure that you have a meaningful and effective volunteer experience. We are looking for a temporary receptionist volunteer at our Main Office located in the Upper East Side. The receptionist will answer the phone and will meet and greet all visitors. A training and supervision will be provided by the Executive Secretary. Skills/ Qualifications: Ability to listen and communicate Professional phone demeanor Ability to present a professional, friendly, and objective appearance to visitors and staff Schedule: Volunteers will be needed from 9a-12p on Thursdays and Fridays. This position is best for a volunteer with a flexible-day schedule or retired corporate professional. If you are interested in this volunteer opportunity, please contact us at: volunteer@carterburdennetwork.org
10075.title: Receptionist Volunteer

10170.description: Purpose: Samuel Waxman Cancer Research Foundation is looking for an individual who can volunteer to provide support at the front desk & for the entire staff. Qualifications: Able to commit to at least one shift: (1 Days) Monday, - Friday: 9 - 1 pm (1 Day) Monday- Friday: 1 - 4 pm - Ability to act resourcefully and with appropriate degree of independence in completing tasks - Follows organizational procedures - Detail oriented - Excellent written and verbal communication skills - Inputs donor data accurately into appropriate databases - Acts in professional polite manner in dealing with colleagues, vendors and members of public - Proficient in Microsoft Office software including Word, Excel, Outlook - Raiser’s Edge experience a plus Duties: Performs tasks effectively in furtherance of the operations of the Samuel Waxman Cancer Research Foundation including those related to donor management, administrative support, data entry & reconciliation. Specific Tasks: - Staff the reception desk - Answer main phone line - Maintaining appropriate organizational records and filing system - Additional operational & administrative tasks - Providing event specific support to the Executive Director - Sorting and distributing mail
10170.title: Front Desk & Operations Volunteer

08861.description: In this position the volunteer will provide the Palliative Care team with office support. Some of the task include entering program statistics into an excel spreadsheet, preparing paperwork for monthly committee meetings, making copies of journal articles and distributing the information to attendees. The volunteer will also prepare bereavement packets, and help with light filing.
08861.title: Palliative Care Clerical Volunteer

08861.description: This volunteer position will provide reception support to the Administrative suite. The receptionist will serve as a support person and is responsible for greeting visitors, patient, or clients, answer telephone calls, filing and other task as assigned.
08861.title: Volunteer Receptionist

08861.description: Make sure that letters and packages are properly sent and delivered to the correct mailbox/business unit. Receive incoming mail from RBMC security team member. Sort mail in a way that makes delivery easy and fast and distribute to the appropriate individual/business unit and place in mailboxes Prepare outgoing mail for pickup by courier. Log in packages from Fed-Ex, UPS, USPS and certified mail. Contact outside medical offices for mail pickup when necessary. Deliver packages to business units that do not fit in the mailbox and have the business unit sign for the package. Maintain inventory of supplies
08861.title: Mail Room Assistant

08861.description: * Escort patients in a wheel chair from the front lobby to their appointments. * Assist with discharging patients as needed. * Work with Patient Escort and Patient Information team members with expediting patient transportation throughout the medical center as assigned. * Retrieve wheel chairs from throughout the medical center.
08861.title: Escort Ambassador

08861.description: \"The willingness of America’s veterans to sacrifice for our country has earned them our lasting gratitude.\" - Jeff Miller If you are a Veteran we could use your help! Compassus Hospice is looking for Veteran volunteers to spend time with fellow veterans at the end of their lives. Veteran volunteers have the unique ability to relate to patients with military service and understand their needs. The camaraderie created between veterans has proven to be supportive for all involved. Join our Veteran to Veteran volunteer program! What can volunteers do? Make friendly visits in facilities near you Provide caregiver relief and respite Complementary Therapy such as Reiki, Massage, and Pet Therapy Read Listen Share a special talent like music or crafts Administrative support What do we provide? Free training at your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Flexible scheduling and patient assignments close to you
08861.title: Military Veterans Needed as Hospice Volunteers

08861.description: Body: \"Reading gives us somewhere to go when we have to stay where we are.\" - Mason Cooley If you enjoy reading, share your love of literature with hospice patients! Some patients have limited eyesight or mobility and cannot enjoy a book the way they once could. Help them escape into the world of Jane Austen or maybe help them enjoy a biography about John F. Kennedy! Contact us for more information. Be the bright spot in someone’s day! What do we provide? Free training at your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Flexible scheduling and patient assignments close to you
08861.title: Love to read? Become a hospice volunteer!

08861.description: \"The difference between friends and pets is that, friends we allow into our company, pets we allow into our solitude.\" - Robert Brault Animals have an overwhelmingly positive affect on so many hospice patients. So many of our Compassus patients have owned pets in the past and miss being around animals; With that being said, please consider sharing your pet’s unconditional love with fellow animal lovers! Your pet will need to be a certified therapy animal. Request more information today! What do we provide? Information on how to get your pet certified for visits. Free training at a location near year and a time based on your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Pet Therapy: Share your pet’s unconditional love with hospice patients!

08861.description: \"Sometimes music is the only medicine the heart and soul need.\" -Anonymous Do you like to sing or play guitar? Do you enjoy sharing your musical talents with others? If the answer is \"yes\" consider becoming a Compassus hospice volunteer! Help bring comfort and joy to patients and their families. Be the bright spot in someone’s day! Because music reaches a deep, non-rational part of the human spirit, it is ideally suited to address complex end of life feelings such as grief, fear, anxiety, sadness, and anger that stand in the way of a clear passage. Music can release blocked or painful feelings and can stimulate positive ones such as hope, love, and gratitude. What do we provide? Free training at a location near year anda time based on your convenience Free TB testing and background check Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Music Volunteers Needed- Singers and Guitar Players Wanted

08861.description: \"No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.\" - Aesop By volunteering with Compassus hospice, you have the wonderful opportunity to make meaningful connections with patients and their families. These non-medical visits may take place at an assisted living facility, nursing home, or in the patient’s own home. We work around YOUR schedule- hours and patient visits are based on your availability. Come be the bright spot in someone’s day! What can volunteers do? Make friendly visits to patients in homes and facilities near you Provide caregiver relief and respite Read Listen Share a special talent like music or crafts Administrative support- in our office or from your home computer. Complementary Therapies such as Reiki, Massage, and Pet Therapy (with proper certifications) What do we provide? Free training at a location near year anda time based on your convenience Free health evaluation and TB test Ongoing educational opportunities Social activities and events Flexible scheduling and patient assignments in your area
08861.title: Love to help people? Become a Hospice Volunteer!

08861.description: The clothing closet attendant will organize and manage all donated items that come into the medical center for our patients. The volunteer will maintain the inventory of donated items and make sure the closet is organized and stocked.
08861.title: Patient Clothing Closet Attendant

08861.description: Volunteer will manage the inventory of in-kind donations, assemble and organize activity packets, puzzle packets and other items used for distribution to patients, and maintain the donation database. Volunteer will also assist with patient experience initiatives as needed.
08861.title: In-Kind Donation Assistant Volunteer

08861.description: Assist Volunter Services department with clerical duties such as patient chart assembly, filing, sorting, collating, and preparing mailings. Other clerical and computer task as requested.
08861.title: Volunteer Services Clerical

08861.description: Provide comfort to families in the surgical waiting room. Answer telephone in waiting area to assist with communication for patients and guest/family/doctors/staff. Set up beverage and light snack service cart for waiting families. Maintain waiting area. Be warm helpful, warm and understanding to waiting families.
08861.title: Surgical Waiting Area Volunteer

08861.description: Provide comfort to families in the surgical waiting room. Answer telephone in waiting area to assist with communication for patients and guest/family/doctors/staff. Set up beverage and light snack service cart for waiting families. Maintain waiting area. Be warm helpful, warm and understanding to waiting families.
08861.title: Surgical Waiting Area Volunteer

08861.description: Visits patients on all nursing units to offer reading material. Bring reading materials to outpatient waiting areas.
08861.title: Book Cart Volunteer

08861.description: Volunter will provide clerical support for designated departments. Task include; answering telephones, filing, sorting, copying, faxing, data entry and other clerical task as needed.
08861.title: Clerical Assistant Volunteer

08861.description: Assists staff by running errands. Volunteers deliver various items throughout the medical center. For example, inter-departmental mail, pharmacy orders, lab orders, drop off mail to departments outside of the medical center, charts, flowers and gifts, medical records, and patient supplies.
08861.title: Volunteer Courier

08861.description: The ED Liaison will provide rounding and facilitate communication between patients and providers in the emergency department acting as a customer service liaison between emergency department staff and patients. The ED Liaison communicates with patients about the patient care process and addresses any needs or concerns that patients or families may have during their stay providing information about wait times, delays, or directions within the facility.
08861.title: Emergency Department Ambassador

08861.description: Sunshine volunteers bring good cheer and smiles to our patients and guest, lifting spirits and brightening their day. The Sunshine volunteer will round the medical center with M.A.C. the Mobile Activity Cart visiting waiting areas, the emergency room and Pediatrics department to offer activity packets to youth guest making their wait time in the clinical areas easier. They will also visit our new mothers in Maternity upon discharge to bring a special gift from the Volunteer Services department. The Sunshine volunteer will also round on patient floors with activity packs for our adult patients. Time commitment is once a week for 3-4 hours depending on patient/guest volume. Ideal start time is 10:00am. One volunteer each day Monday-Friday.
08861.title: Sunshine Volunteer

08861.description: The Hospitality Specialist will provide excellent customer service to patients and guest to ensure that all guest are comfortable and answer any questions they may have. Centrally located on the concourse the specialist will addresses any needs or concerns that guest or their families may have during their visit or redirect them to the proper department. The specialist will provide directions, escort guest to their destination, serve as a liaison to fulfill request from staff (in patient care areas) for patients (i.e.... books, newspapers, bibles, magazines, activity packs etc.)and provide service that exceeds the guest expectations.
08861.title: Hospitaltiy Ambassador

08861.description: Provide rounding on out-patient waiting areas to serve as a point of contact, and act as the medical centers eyes and ears to ensure that all guest are comfortable and answer any questions visitors may have. The specialist will facilitate communication between out-patient guest and the department they are receiving services from. The specialist will addresses any needs or concerns that guest or their families may have during their visit providing information about wait times, delays, and directions within the facility.
08861.title: Service Excellence Ambassador

08861.description: Visits patient floors and spends time with patients deemed either a falls risk, or in need of a little extra TLC. Bedside Buddies can service all designated in-patient adult areas (they are not stationed in one place) and carry a \"buddy kit\" stocked with games they can play with the patient, small projects, or simply to sit and chat for a while.
08861.title: Bedside Buddy Patient Visitor

08861.description: To provide patients the opportunity to interact with trained and certified dogs during their hospitalization to improve thieir emotional and social status.
08861.title: Pet Therapy (Perth Amboy)

08861.description: To welcome medical center visitors (outpatient) and provide directions and/or personally escort visitors to their destinations. To reinforce the medical centers misson to provide exceptional customer service.
08861.title: Medical Center Greeter

08861.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08861.title: Mentor Disadvantaged Youth

08869.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship with their certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
08869.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Reiki - Raritan

08904.description: We are looking for volunteers to help us distribute fresh produce to those in need this summer, as well as volunteers to help us pick up food deliveries in New Brunswick, stock our shelves, and take part in our regular distributions of non-perishable foods. There are lots of ways you can help -- even if you just have just an hour a month to give. Contact us or learn more on our website: http://sites.google.com/site/hpfoodpantry/ Volunteers are needed on Tuesday mornings, Wednesday mornings and evenings, Thursday mornings, Thursday evenings, Friday late afternoons, and Saturday mornings. Mostly we prefer volunteers who will commit to a regular schedule of volunteering at the same time every month, but one-time or occasional volunteers are allowed on Wednesday evenings and Friday afternoons. Wednesday evenings are the only time that we can allow volunteers who are younger than 18. It's a great group of people -- come lend a hand and meet some of them!
08904.title: Highland Park Food Pantry

08901.description: Help combat community hunger at the 5 Loaves Pantry. Volunteers help unload and sort food, organize pantry items, and assist clients with shopping.
08901.title: Marketplace in New Brunswick

08901.description: The Salvation Army New Brunswick is looking for volunteers to assist with sweeping, mopping, dusting, cleaning windows and vacuuming. Changing garbage receptacles daily and waxing floors once a month. Volunteers are needed every Friday from 9:00am-2pm
08901.title: Indoor Maintenance Aide - New Brunswick
08901.org: The Salvation Army - New Jersey Division

08901.description: The Salvation Army New Brunswick needs reliable volunteers who can help with the maintenance and operations of their food pantry. Specific duties and responsibilities include: help stock food pantry shelves; assist with food delivery; occasionally assist with food drives; check for expiration dates; keep food items in rotation; help stock the walk-in freezer; package food items and occasionally assemble boxes. Ideally, the volunteer able to work with a diverse group of people. Volunteer must be able to read dates and product labels; be able to push a loaded flat-bed cart and have a knowledge/experience of shopping requirements. For deliveries, the volunteer must be able to lift 50 lbs and withstand cold temperatures within the walk-in freezer. Not all skills and qualifications are necessary. Volunteer hours can be flexible within the needed times. Must be available 2 hours weekly Mon-Friday 9am-3pm
08901.title: Food Pantry Assistant -New Brunswick Corps
08901.org: The Salvation Army - New Jersey Division

08901.description: JerseySTEM recruits College students to coach/teach STEM classes to underserved kids in New Jersey. For that, we mobilize: - Volunteer College Students to teach, - Libraries and Middle Schools to host - Corportations to sponsor The University Liaison serves as a conduit between JerseySTEM and the different institutions affiliated with the university. Duties: - Coordinate and/or Attend career fairs (twice a ear) - Connect with Deans and faculty to explore opportunities - Connect with students groups, collegiate chapters of professional societies to explore parterships Estimated time: - 2-4 hours/week. Mostly email. Please submit a resume and.or a linkedin profile.
08901.title: UNI: University Liaison @ Rutgers New Brunswick

08901.description: MusicLink is in need of experienced music teachers in New Jersey. With MusicLink, students (children under 18 years old) who show an interest in taking music lessons, but cannot afford full fee lessons, are linked with qualified music teachers willing to reduce their fee by at least half to make the lessons more affordable. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation. MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check. Please see our website for more information: www.musiclinkfoundation.org .
08901.title: Music Teachers for Underprivileged Children

08901.description: Meals on Wheels in Greater New Brunswick is looking for a CPA or retired CPA to serve as treasurer on their Board of Directors. Meals on Wheels in Greater New Brunswick is a not-for-profit, 501c3 organization delivering two nutritionally balanced meals each weekday to the elderly and homebound in New Brunswick and Highland Park. For more information, please contact us at mowgnb@aol.com or 732-249-3488
08901.title: Board Treasurer
08901.org: Meals on Wheels in Greater New Brunswick

08901.description: Transports children/patients in wheelchairs/stretchers or walks with patients to and from therapy departments. Important functional area of volunteer service requiring reliable and conscientious person who is able to make a reasonable long term commitment
08901.title: Internal Transporter

As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
08901.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Central NJ

08901.description: To offer 1:1 assistance to boys and girls ages 3-10 years old who are participating in an adapted swim program. Having 1:1 volunteers with children promotes safety for children, encourages participants to feel comfortable in the water, and gives individual attention and encouragement to help each child do his or her best. You do not need any special training or certification. You must be 15 years old to volunteer.
08901.title: Swim Volunteers Needed

08901.description: George Street Co-op is a non-profit natural & vegetarian foods store owned and run by its members. We’re looking for a PHP programmer to help us revamp our website and backend database. Depending on your time commitment, you can earn a discount between 8% and 25% on all Co-op goods. Please include your phone number in your contact info, and let us know whether you can receive text messages. Thanks!
08901.title: PHP programmer

08901.description: George Street Co-op is a non-profit natural foods store operated by its members, offering the best earth-friendly goods we can find. We’ve got a great team of enthusiastic workers, and we’re hoping to upgrade our facilities a bit to make working here more efficient and enjoyable. We’ll provide parts & materials, of course. Depending on your time commitment, you’ll earn a discount up to 25% on all Co-op merchandise. Please indicate the best days and times for you to work. Also, please include your phone number, and let us know if you can receive text messages. Thanks!
08901.title: Carpenter / Builder / Savior for an Ancient Building!

08901.description: The Co-op has a six-hour shift open for a volunteer weekend produce manager on either Saturdays or Sundays. In addition to teaching you everything about organic fruits and vegetables, this opportunity will earn you a 25% discount on everything the Co-op sells -- an amazing deal! The Co-op is a non-profit natural foods store owned and run by its members, selling vegetarian foods with the greatest nutritional value possible, and only minimal processing or additives. Everyone is welcome to shop at the Co-op and choose from our excellent selection of fresh organic produce, bulk foods, vitamins & herbs, body care products and more.
08901.title: Weekend Produce Manager

08901.description: The Co-op has a spot open for a volunteer cleaner/closer. This is a great opportunity if you prefer to work in the late evening. This shift can earn you a discount between 8% and 25% on all Co-op goods. It's a great deal, so contact us here if you're interested, and we'll get you started real quick! The George Street Co-op is a non-profit natural foods store owned and run by its members. We sell vegetarian foods with the greatest nutritional value possible, and only minimal processing or additives. Everyone is welcome to shop at the Co-op and choose from our excellent selection of fresh organic produce, bulk foods, vitamins & herbs, body care and earth-friendly products, gifts, and more.
08901.title: Volunteer Cleaner/Closer

08901.description: George Street Co-op in New Brunswick NJ is seeking floor workers to join our amazing volunteer team. Volunteering just two hours per week will earn you a 15% discount on all Co-op products. Volunteering six hours per week will earn you 25%! We'll schedule a shift time which fits your needs while still benefiting the Co-op. Applicants for this position are expected to be enthusiastic, trustworthy, and principled. You'd be challenged to find a more enjoyable work environment. Everyone working at the Co-op is here because they love it. See our Facebook page to get a sense of the buzz!

08901.description: Meals are delivered Monday - Friday 10:30 am - 12 noon. We partner a driver and a jumper. We ask that our volunteers deliver at least twice a month. Monday - Friday available. However, at this time we really need volunteers for Monday, Wednesday, Friday. We ask that you deliver at least twice a month.
08901.title: Driver or Jumper
08901.org: Meals on Wheels in Greater New Brunswick

08901.description: Our 1902 Carnegie library building needs a variety of small handyman-level tasks done. This beautiful building needs someone who has the skill and who will take the time to do these jobs properly.
08901.title: Handyman

08901.description: Catholic Charities Connections Program is actively recruiting volunteers to work as mentors with children ages 5-17. Mentors offer support, guidance, and education as a youth goes through a difficult time, faces new challenges or opportunities, or takes on an important task. A mentor is a person who is willing to share their life-long expertise to provide support to the youth. Mentors can play an important role as the youth develops mentally and emotionally to help a youth understand their goals and personal needs. Mentors must be a minimum of 18 years of age. Prospective mentors will undergo an intensive screening process consisting of: application and informal autobiography, personal interview, reference checks, criminal background check, driving record check and program orientation. The program serves youth in Middlesex County. Mentoring is the process of sharing personal knowledge and skills with a young person.
08901.title: Adult Mentoring

08902.description: Dear Residents of South Brunswick Public Schools Do you want to make a difference in a young person's life; while you learn about another culture, create and build friendships and make ever-lasting memories? Do you have a caring heart and extra space in your home? AnB Education is looking for you! Make a difference today and host an international student! All our students need is: A Private bedroom with a desk, bed and dresser 2 meals a day on school days and 3 meals a day on non school days Transportation to and from school if there is no school buses provided Please contact AnB Headquarters office at: 267.263.2481 or email to contact@anbeducation.com Company website: www.anbeducation.com
08902.title: Volunteer Host Families for International students

08903.description: Child Placement Review Boards review children that have been placed in out of home placements such as foster care or residential placements due to an abuse and neglect case that has been filed againt one or both parents. The boards receive information from the Department of Child Protection and Permanency fomerly the division of Youth and Family Services With the reading material and meeting with Foster parents, parents and any other interested parties they collectively make recommendations to the Judge as to what is best for the child. The recommendation is very helpful to the Judge in proceeding with the case and has an important impact on the families.
08903.title: Assist children in out of home placements become a Child Placement Review Board Volunteer
08903.org: Superior Court New Jersey Middlesex Vicinage

08903.description: Juvenile Conference Committee Superior Court of NJ Middlesex County is seeking volunteers to become members of the the Juvenile Conference Committee. The Juvenile Conference Committee meets in the evening once a month. We would like citizens from the community to sit on this board as volunteers and help guide the children. They make recommendations to the Judge as to how the complaint should be handled within the community. The goals are to involve community members in the court process and to prevent young offenders from future delinquency. Child Placement Review Board Superior Court of NJ is seeking Middlesex County Residents to volunteers and become members of the Child Placement Review Board. There are two 45 day review boards located at 120 New Street in New Brunswick, Family Court House. Residents of Middlesex will monitor the cases of all children who are placed outside their home by the Division of Youth & Family Services. Review case files, discuss cases with team, and make recommendations. Division of Youth and Family Services (DFYS) workers are at the meetings to clarify any questions pertaining to the cases. The Volunteers in Probation Program is staffed with volunteers from the community who mentor adults on probation. Each volunteer will be assigned to supervise an adult on probation. You will meet once a week with the probationer to make sure they are fulfilling the requirements of their probation & to maintain regular contact with the supervising probation officer. Volunteers address issues in the court order that include employment,education and counseling. Only probationers with minor or non-violent offenses are allowed to participate in the program .
08903.title: VOLUNTEERS MAKE A DIFFERENCE
08903.org: Superior Court New Jersey Middlesex Vicinage
